Reviews.Content: Stayed here, for the second time in November, over the Thanksgiving weekend for four nights and hated to leave. The room was extremely welcoming and comfortable (albeit cold, owing to a renovation that neglected to include dual-pane windows in the budget). I liked the decor and everything was functional and aesthetically pleasing. Great work desk, huge flat panel tv, an ipod dock. The room had good seating. nice bedding, a nice shower and good sink / vanity area (I was in a jr. suite). The location, with easy access to Union Square area, can't be beat WITHOUT having to trek up the steep hills. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and clearly had the authority to "make it right". (example: bought a vending Pepsi that was dated as expiring in August. I took it to the front desk and the clerk promptly retrieved two cold replacements, with an apology and a promise to tell the vendor. A small matter, but telling about the staff.) Interactions with Henry Wong (manager) were extremely pleasant as he was a good listener and engaged with the guests. The concierge (she's blond and I'm sorry I can't remember her name) was UBER helpful and gave me a recommendation that knocked my socks off. The bar staff was very friendly and helpful during my one visit with a friend. So, for location, attentive service, and a very nice room that's well appointed, I would stay again, and recommend to a friend, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Parking Fees!”
Reviews.Author: BaseballMom2544
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on recommendations from this website. The location was fantastic, as it was very close to Union Square. However, we were shocked to find out that the parking was $48 per day....and they charged us an additional $10 for our SUV!! I am disappointed that not one review that I read mentioned this outrageous parking fee. Since we have never been to San Francisco, we didn't know to check into parking. Had we known, we would have made other arrangements and saved ourselves $106! So....ask about parking when you stay in San Francisco!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GoTBGo
Reviews.Content: A simply wonderful property. Great location, comfortable rooms and professional staff. The lobby lounge was comfortable for drinks or meals. The rooms are not terribly large so I would not recommend for a family, but for business travel or for a couple enjoying the city it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SactoJD
Reviews.Content: First time here. Stayed because it's a Marriott (I'm a Rewards member) and they had a decent AAA rate. THE GREAT: The staff: every person I interacted with was on the ball. Bell service and front desk especially. Follow through: had some rowdies in the hall our second night. Called the front desk and they must have had someone up there pretty quick, because it did quiet down. Then, they left a follow up note under my door! Amazing. I've never seen, nor heard of, anything like that before. Rooms: nicely appointed, apparently recently overhauled in a major way. Location: A block off Union Square. Great pillows, and lots of 'em! THE GOOD: The wine bar in the lobby was nice. The wines by the glass were just ok. Bottles had likely been opened for more than a day. If you sell yourself as a wine lounge you gotta be on that! Service was good though, and appetizers were reasonably priced. THE SO-SO: Gap under my door was oddly big. A lot of hall light poured into the room at night as a result. This may have also played a part in the noise traveling in so easily. But only an issue that one night. Breakfast was prohibitively expensive, so went to Lori's on the corner instead. Parking was also pretty pricey, breaking the $50 mark for me for the first time. BOTTOM LINE: Would (WILL) stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ErinS3204
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the location of this hotel! Everything was so conveniently located. The cable cars, buses, food, everything! We would definitely stay here next time we come to san francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for the price”
Reviews.Author: kenjidm
Reviews.Content: Me and my stayed here in October for 2 nights. We were in San Francisco for a wedding. Anyhow, the hotel is in the heart and soul of SF. The Cable Car is right outside the hotel entrance. You are also 1/2 a mile from Chinatown and walking distance to the shopping malls. Fishermans Wharf is also not to very far. If your visiting SF, I'd recommend this hotel. The rooms are clean, staff is nice, the location is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: sctmtn
Reviews.Content: Prompt, courteous service, although the front desk registrar was overly inquisitive. Room was spacious, nicely appointed. Things I expected to be present that weren't were courtesy bathrobes and a hairdryer. Location was very convenient. Amenities were ample. We ate a light meal in the restaurant, which was also nicely appointed and inviting. Service was adequate and fare tasty and reasonable. Overnight parking charge I deemed to be excessive. Fortunately, we didn't have a car, so this was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Very Clean & Great Service... but very routine with small room”
Reviews.Author: jerrythetraveler
Reviews.Content: Good Location located a block from Union Square. Located near many great restaurants including Sears (not the department store), Rosi Dinner, Burger Bar, The Starlight Room, Il Rulli and many more. The property is right along the street car route and close to China Town, the Fairmont and the Embarcadero. This Marriott was Very Clean & the hotel staff try very hard (as expected), but be prepared for frequent language barriers with the staff if you speak english. Also some of the front desk staff are moody, but the Manager Chris and Team member Frances were very helpful. There is no restaurant on premisis for dinner, but with so many great options nearby it is not really an issue. The breakfast was a little limited, but very tasty and clean. The bar was quiet, except a few social events, but was great for adjunct meetings during my stay. The F&B had Great Service, their Manager Phillip was a stand out, and room service was very prompt. My problems with the property were few, but as always I had a couple. The rooms were small, even by San Fran standards, but with a great location in a city like SF we did not spend much time in the room. The design was clean, but a little routine. Most of all was Valet, they drove me crazy. They were never at the door and this hotel really needs a full time doorman. As a result after the first night I parked elsewere. I recomend you park at the Sutter Garage one block before the Marriott on Sutter. You have to enter on Bush. I parked at that garage for less than $20.00 and day and $13.00 overnight on the weekend, a big break from the nearly $55.00 the hotel charged. The weekend rate was less than $200.00 a night and included breakfast, but the weekday rates were better at the JW Marriott around the block, so I moved after Monday. Overall the property was great, the views on the top floors left me speachless (really) and the staff tried very hard. Also the conceirge lounge was very clean and well appointed. I ussally stay at the Club Quarters, Westin Market or Marquis (TheJukeBox), but with the location and recent renovation, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Bay Area Marriott”
Reviews.Author: HeatherSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I try to stay in Marriott Hotels whenever possible as I'm a rewards member & try to accrue points. Staying in this property is pure pleasure! The lobby is up two or three floors & is attractive & very welcoming; with multiple fireplaces, lounge like seating areas with flat screen tv's near the bar. The whole atmosphere is inviting. I traveled alone & did not think it a good idea to hang out near the bar - but I was really tempted! It looks so pleasant. The front desk staff was cordial & professional during all of my interactions. The sundry shop near the lobby is particularly upscale, although small. I bought a unique pair of earrings made by a local artist - not cheap - but definitely special - & was tempted to buy the books & art pieces on display as well. I really liked my room. The view was over ductwork, but I wasn't in it much to look out. The bath was very attractive; dark marble, nicely lit, great tub & shower. I liked everything about it! The bed was extremely comfortable. I don't know if all Marriott mattresses are supposed to be the same, but this one was really perfect! I look forward to returning to this property, which is an easy walk from BART on Powell & to Nordstroms & other great shops. Easy to get to from SFO & convenient by taxi to just about everywhere. Thank you for making my stay so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: calflyer80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property many times when it was a Holiday Inn and Crowne Plaza. The hotel was very good than and has become much better under the Marriott banner. The location is outstanding for any visitor to San Francisco. Right on the Powell Street cable car line. Easy acess to Union Square shopping and a short walk to Chinatown. The staff was friendly and efficient. Bottomline the hospitality was exceptional. Based on this stay the Marriott Union Square is now my first choice when staying in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Dara123
Reviews.Content: Union square is a really nice and convenient area, and this hotel is perfectly situated in the middle. A few blocks from the Powell St. BART station and blocks from Chinatown, this is a great hotel in an amazing location. The king-size bed was just divine, and the shower was so good. I'd definitely stay here again if I find myself in San Fran in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: asnc76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights in June 2010. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to good restuarants and shopping. Rooms were nice with plenty of space.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay on the 29th floor”
Reviews.Author: Shana073
Reviews.Content: We picked this location due to great reviews and a great location. While the location was quite ideal, I can say our stay was only fair. When we checked in early, they were kind enough to find us a room on the 29th floor (second to top floor). While we checked in, we got to listen to a front desk associate rudely talk to a person she was checking in who indicated that he had booked a different room than he was given (her response to him was essentially "prove it" instead of trying to help resolve the situation). When we got to our room we were initially pleased although disappointed that the concierge lounge would be closed until the next evening around dinner time. My husband and I then went out for the day and evening and when we returned that night, realized the possibly worst problem with the hotel... weddings on the 30th floor. It was 9pm when we arrived back to our room. The music was loud as could be and our room was shaking. We figured, wait til 10pm before saying anything... but we were on east coast time and every tired so we decided to call and ask when the wedding would be over. We were informed it "should" be ending at midnight. So obviously, we could not stay in our room! That is a serious flaw in the floor plans of the hotel as the rooms under the ballroom are not usable to sleep in when a party is going on directly above. So, to their defense, they did help us move our room and our belongings (which was much appreciated) but by the time we re-unpacked and got settled it was already after 10pm (or 1am EST) and we were very tired and acky from our long flight. The next morning, since there was no concierge lounge open for use, I ventured downstairs to ask about the other dining options in the area to which I was informed by the exceptionally rude front desk lady that "we aren't giving you a voucher just because the concierge is closed, that is standard marriott." Well first of all, no it isn't. Second of all, I never even asked about a voucher or the concierge lounge, I only asked what dining options were available in the area. I guess I would sum it up to say if all you are looking for is good location and a nice looking clean hotel, this is a great place. But as I said in the title... dont allow them to put you on the 29th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but lacked the Marriott personal attention”
Reviews.Author: baloobear
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of SF and handy for all tourist needs. Rooms are on the spacious side for SF, and if you get a higher floor the views aren't bad at all. Rooms feel modern and beds are superbly comfortable the only thing that lets the hotel down are that staff are efficient but not that personable vs other Marriotts I have stayed at. Saying that would stay here again when next in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, But There Were Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: WalnutBaron
Reviews.Content: We often stay in San Francisco for weekend getaways and decided to try this newest of Marriott's hotels in The City. The location is about a block north of Union Square, so it's pretty centrally located. Staff was friendly and helpful, consistent with Marriott standards. The problem, however, is that our room was right next to the elevator shaft and the elevator needed maintenance. It creaked each time it stopped on our floor--all night long. I didn't ask to get transferred to a different room in the middle of the night, but--needless to say--we didn't get a lot of sleep either. To their credit, the manager comped us the room, which I very much appreciate. But it was a less-than-satisfying experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for San Francisco Vacationers”
Reviews.Author: Android_290764
Reviews.Content: Surprised on arrival that no assistance was offered by a bell-boy to take our luggage to the room. Once inside, the room didn't disappoint. Tastefully decorated bathroom with quality toiletries. Comfortable beds and pillows were appreciated after a long haul flight from the UK. The fee of $12.95 per day for Wi-Fi access is steep given that it is almost essential these days.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Front Desk Clerk Should Not Be Working With the Public”
Reviews.Author: scout1LosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We picked the hotel for the location. When we arrived in the afternoon I dropped my wife off with our luggage and I went to return our rental car. The front desk clerk (a man) refused to check her in because the reservation was in my name (even though we share the same last name as well as sharing the same credit card used to book the hotel.) Also, the bell hop helped with the luggage, and he was aware that I was leaving to return the car whilst my wife checked in.) The front desk clerk (a man) flatly refused to check her in, explaining that he worked in the hotel industry for 20 years and he suspected my wife of using deceit to gain entrance to my hotel room (really). My wife called me and asked me to give my consent to have her check into the hotel (really). Oh, the clerk also asked me to physically describe my wife. We travel a lot and this was the worst hotel check in experience we've ever had. The front desk clerk is not qualified to work with the public.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea. Moved to another hotel after one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: bossgoss
Reviews.Content: We were very excited about our 4 night trip to SF with our teenage daughter and had booked a one bedroom suite with the intention of having her friend come join us for one night. When we arrived at our room I immediately called the front desk to say this was the wrong room. While very lovely, it was a "junior suite" and had a queen bed and sofa sleeper all in the same room. If we were all going to be sleeping in the same room, which would be ackward with my daughter's friend, at least two beds were preferable to sleeping on a sofa sleeper. I was told that they did not have a one bedroom suite. I asked if they had another room and was told they did not. They were not very accomodating or concerned about our happiness or comfort. Lacked basic amenities of hotes in this class. No safes in rooms, no minibar, no bathrobes in rooms (have to call and ask), no swimming pool. And the parking fee was ridiculous; nearly $70/night with tax.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: srcesq
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 4 nights, they accommodated our crazy travel with late check in and late check out. The room was comfortable for 3, enough space so we were not an top of eachother. Bathroom was functional. Location is great, right on the Powell cable car line and an easy walk for San Francisco to the Powell muni station where you can get muni or bart. We only ate breakfast at the hotel and the buffet was limited for a Marriott, so I didn't think that it was priced properly for what was offered, but the menu did have some great alternatives, and a diverse Health Conscious menu, but still pricey. My biggest complaint was the internet. The cost for 24 hour wifi in your room was too high and didn't last the full 24 hours that youpaid for. Also we have 2 laptops, so for both to use we had to pay twice, even if being used at different times. The biggest insult was the cost to use the computer and printing in the business center. $6.95 for 15 minutes, and 0.49 cents to print a page in black ink is disgusting. I am staying at a Marriott, even Hampton Inn gives free business center internet use. THis cheapened the stay. The fitness center was one of the best that I have seen. Many cardio machines and enough weight training that I could be clsoe to my normal workout routine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a terrific location!”
Reviews.Author: demetgolf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value. The management and staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I would recommend the hotel to anyone for business or pleasure. You cannot beat the Union Square location. The rooms have been recently updated and lobby area was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Liseleje
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a very good location, only 1 block away from Union Square. We were on 18 floor facing Sutter street and the room was brand new and very quite. The beds are not the biggest but you can sleep 2 en each bed if you need to. There are an ok gym as well.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more!”
Reviews.Author: nhfiremanpaul
Reviews.Content: Ok, when I decided to write this review I went on to see what others had wrote. I had to do a double take to make sure I was talking about the same hotel. So before someone says "I think he was mistaken and meant to write about somewhere else", I checked my bill to the address to this hotel and it is the same. This was one of the unpleasant experiences I had staying in a hotel. Took the front desk 45 minutes to check me in because they didn't have my room choice. I actually told them I didn't care and just give me a room and they still had problems. The front desk guy blamed it on house keeping for not having the fossy system update blah blah blah... Who cares, I just want my room. Oh, and it was 7pm when I was checking in. The room was fine but I didn't have any hand or face towels. Also no tissue or shampoo. (For four days. I brought my own stuff any ways.) But nothing like calling down to the front desk for a roll of toilet tissue on your first night. But the straw that broke the camels back was the stuck up woman sitting at the concierge desk. I came up and asked some questions and she was just plain rude to me. I ended up checking out two days early and went to the JW Marriott and paid more money. I will never stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good Marriott - executive rooms well worth the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: BexEee
Reviews.Content: Great door staff and lovely check-in although the service varied drastically with one of the women on front desk being out right rude. We had a nice room on one of the executive floors (27th) with floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the city - great view! The complimentary nibbles and soft drinks in the executive lounge were really tasty (served between 5-10pm Sunday-Friday only) and also a really good free breakfast (although only served until 9am). There's also a computer with free internet access which is handy but no free wi-fi in the hotel. The hotel is right in the centre of the city but still quite peaceful if you're in one of the higher rooms. Overall a really good hotel I'd definitely recommend the California Academy of Science museum in San Francisco too, really up-to-date with loads to see and do. Also the Alcatraz night tour. Dr C

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Daisy38
Reviews.Content: After traveling cross country, being welcomed by friendly front desk staff was great. The staff at the hotel are welcoming and helpful. The hotel looked to be newly remodeled. Everything was new and fresh. We received a corner room and it was quite spacious. The concierge lounge is nice. The food selections were the same as other Marriotts' and the view is great. However, one concierge begins picking up breakfast foods at 8:55 even though breakfast is supposed to be served until 9:00 a.m. Before our trip we couldn't decide between staying in Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf. A friend that lives in SF recommended Union Square. I agree. This hotel is right by the cable car stop. If you buy the SF City Pass, you can show your pass rather than pay each time. The shopping by this hotel is better than any I've ever been to in my life. Within walking distance are: Macy's, Neiman-Marcus, Sak's Fifth Avenue, Bloomingdale's, Nordstrom's and tons of other shops. This hotel would be perfect for a shopping vacation. It is also within walking distance of Chinatown and lots of restaurants. Since there are many downtown hotels in this area, there are many tourists around day and night, so the area feels safe. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: ttravelerbug
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my five year old while my husband was there for business. The hotel was in a great location for us and we were able to walk or take public transportation where ever we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bed, all good”
Reviews.Author: nottarockstar
Reviews.Content: A solid Marriott in a great part of town, I enjoyed my stay here. Maybe a bit overpriced, but I went on Memorial Day Weekend, so what can you do? The rooms aren't huge, but like NYC, you can expect that in most SF locations. The bed was awesome - I slept so well. Other than that, cool color schemes and a nice lobby, but the room is fairly standard. I noticed on my last morning that the windows opened, bummed I didn't figure that out earlier in my stay - the weather was awesome. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonAVB
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference held at hotel so no real choice over hotel. Also first visit to SF so wasn't aware of good or bad locations. However the location of this hotel is idea for all that is going on around Union Square. Great resturants and shops. Easy to get to Fishermans Wharf - 30 minute walk (although uphill a lot of the way). Cabs or cable cars are easy to get. Rooms are a decent size compared with others I have stayed at in US. Bathrooms are funcitonal rather than luxurious although this I feel this is typical of the US.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location & Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Bella213
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to San Francisco, my husband and I chose to stay at the San Francisco Marriott Union Square. Since this was our first trip to San Francisco, we chose this hotel based off reviews we read and the location. I have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel. Our flight landed around 12:00 and we were at the hotel by about 1:00. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, we knew we made a great choice in hotels. The door man greeted us with a smile and helped us bring our luggage from the taxi inside. If any of you pack like I do, you know this is no easy task! Since I had to pay $25 per bag up to 50 pounds, you know I utilized each pound in each bag!! Anyway, check in was flawless (plus they let us check in early which is always a plus) and everyone was extremely friendly. We booked a King Guest Room. The entire hotel appeared to have been recently remodeled; everything was modern and extremely clean. Our room was clean and modern (like the rest of the hotel) and extremely quiet. We have stayed in hotels in the past and barely got a minute of sleep because of the noise from elevators and other guests. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was always kept clean and there was always plenty of hot water. (Believe it or not, we have stayed in hotels where there wasnâ€™t enough hot water). The location couldnâ€™t be better; it is centrally located to many attractions. Plus, there is a pick up for the famous cable cars right outside the hotel and a Starbucks is right across the street with Union Square only about a minute walk away from the entrance to the hotel. Many tours start and end at Union Square, so this was a definite plus for us! While reading reviews before our trip, some people complained about the service and friendliness of the employees at this hotel. I can say, with 100% complete honesty, that any time I had a question I was always answered with a smile and provided accurate information. Every time we entered or departed from the hotel, we were acknowledged warmly. The employees were always happy and helpful; no one ever seemed to be angry, upset or unwilling to help. Overall, this was a fantastic trip which could have been ruined if our hotel wasnâ€™t so great. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning a trip to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: LadyElaine24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a relaxing week at this conveniently located hotel. We arrived on a Sunday at noon expecting to stow our luggage until the 3 p.m. check-in. Chris, the desk clerk, listened carefully to our request for a nice-sized quiet king room away from the elevator and offered to check us into room 2108 immediately. We were pleased with his choice. The room was spotless and peaceful. We rarely heard noise in the hallway or outside our floor-to-ceiling windows, which offered nice views of downtown and the bay on a clear day. There was a comfortable reading chair, lamp and ottoman by the window. The two of us had ample space to unpack our clothes and stretch out. The bathroom wasn't huge, but provided plenty of counter space and shelves. At our request, we received a mini-fridge and feather-free room. Best of all, we have never slept so well in our lives. Marriott's Heavenly Bed and blackout curtains struck another home run. The last morning, we enjoyed the hotel's buffet breakfast, which we felt offered better food, higher value and faster service than nearby Sears. We also used the hotel's fitness center. We greatly appreciated the kiosks in the lobby, which allowed us to check in our flights and pay for checked luggage in advance. That proved a HUGE timesaver at the airport. A few areas to improve: We paid $199 plus taxes per weekday. (The AAA rate dropped to $125 plus taxes over the weekend.) For the weekday price, we were appalled to learn that Marriott charged nearly $30 per day for Internet use. Most coffee shops will allow you to log on for free. There is no fan in the bathroom, causing shower steam and odors to linger. This seems to be consistent with other Marriotts we've frequented. The hotel wasn't busy, yet no one brought us a cart or offered to help us with our luggage. The staff was terrific when we stored our suitcases and laptop after checkout, however. The layout of the hotel is a little truncated. There is no central lobby or social area. When you walk in, the front desk and concierge are to the right and the bar is to the left. Overall, however, we enjoyed our stay and wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Better Places to Stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: Duke001
Reviews.Content: I have 600,000 Marriott points and stay in Marriott's frequently and this is my second stay here. The old adage is fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice shame on me. Well, the shame is on me. I thought it would change since it has been about two years, but it hasn't. I will never stay here again. Hate it! The hotel is falling apart. Examples are the lights on the elevators not working, tile coming off the wall, toilet not flushing correctly, clock on the radio not working, elite perks = zero. Plus, the people who work here don't care. Keep in mind my number of Marriott points and the fact that I normally love Marriott. The Conceirge (more than one) are poorly trained. It was not only the incorrect directions which sent me a block in the wrong direction, it was also things like; us, "where can you recommend I go for breakfast," them, "Sears Fine Foods," us. "Oh I went there in September and the Swedish pancakes were not very good," them, "that is correct, they closed for a year and reopened under new ownership and have changed." Us, left unsaid, okay then why did you recommend them in the first place, laziness? Checking in they don't listen to your request (a local paper to them is USA Today). Overall, the best that could be said is that there is nothing, absolutely nothing special about this Marriott. Although it provides you with a comfortable bed (albeit with small pillows) it is a high price for what is really a second rate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Marriott Experience, but small room”
Reviews.Author: KimKDallas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Union Square on business a couple of weeks ago. It was my first visit to this property. Not my favorite Marriott property, but definitely up to standard. Checkin Fast and efficient. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room Got what had to be their standard room -- but it felt REALLY small. You couldn't open the closet door and the door to the room at the same time. Bathroom was so small that the sink / vanity was less than 18 inches wide. Just very crowded. Room was clean and bed was comfy. Concierge Lounge Lounge was really nice at this property. Breakfast was great -- eggs, pastries, fruit, and hot / cold cereals. The Chocolate mini muffinsare great! Staff was friendly, and lounge was decently sized. Never made in for appetizers, but desserts were also nice -- there were a variety of items available. Room Service Quick and tasty --- although at standard room service rates. Their clam chowder is to die for and the cheese platter makes a great compliment! Overall --- nice business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They let us go.”
Reviews.Author: flaura
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel over the phone. I was offered the lowest rate for a 2 night stay over Easter weekend. On the drive up to the hotel from LA. I went on the hotels web site on my phone and noticed that they offered a rate package that included breakfast and parking. Upon arrival I asked if we could switch to this package even if it was a bit more per night. It was worth it for parking alone. There is a $50 overnight fee at most hotel in SF. The front desk said our rate could not be changed because I had booked the lowest rate. (Though I was allowed to upgrade our room to the club level.) I told her that if she could not change my rate to include this package, I would check out in the morning. I would have left that moment, if it not were for the cancelation policy. (We had already been charged for our first night.) She went to talk to the manager. She came back a few minutes better and simply said; "So we now have you with us for only one night." I felt like I was in the Twilight Zone. The hotel was empty. We are in a bad economy. You would think that Marriott would care to keep my business. Instead they were happy to let us go. I did not want to make a scene in front of my kids. So instead decided to got up to our very small but clean and new room to talk to the manager on the phone. While my family enjoyed snacks and refreshments in the club lounge. Bad idea. The manager was clueless. He did not understand that the bigger problem was that their service was so bad that they let paying costumers leave their hotel because they could not change a rate, to a higher one even. And that his front desks indifferent attitude was insulting. He said he did not understand what the problem was and why we where so unhappy. He was confused and did not understand what they did wrong. This hotel does not care about it's customers. We switched to the Serrano Hotel in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: expatinlondon17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott 3 times in a week as I came back and forth into San Fran. It's a great location, within an easy walk of the Ferry Building and quite a bit of shopping. The bell staff were particularly helpful in handling my baggage that I left on and off with them. The front desk were less than helpful frankly. Not the most friendly lot and certainly unwilling to go out of their way when I was in a rush and needed to leave a bag with them. Seems they were unwilling to handle it for me, but rather made me take it to find a bellman to have it stored. They also sent my friend and I to a jazz club which had apparently been shut for years. The rooms were typical marriott standard, with comfy beds. Irritatingly you had to pay for internet access, which isn't really acceptable in this day and age. Oh, and their barman does not know how to make a decent mojito. Not the end of the world but worth noting...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value, definitely recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: kc-bug
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be all-around great! The location was very accessible to all that San Francisco has to offer. It's right on a cable car line. We were worried that the rooms would be small because we read reviews that most SF rooms are small, but that was not the case. And the beds...they were heavenly! We all commented that we had the best hotel-sleep in a long time!!! The bellmen were extremely helpful and not the pushy type that expect tips just for saying hello. Check-in went well, and the staff we met in the hallways were very friendly. Our view was only of the building across the street, but when you're in San Fran, who wants to stay in a hotel anyways? The bathrooms were nice, the linens were fabulous, and the decor throughout was fresh and colorful. We got a steal of a deal; make sure you push for discounts. I was quoted different prices each time I called, but they made the right choice and honored the lowest deal I was quoted. I appreciated their professionalism and definitely recommend the Marriott @ Union Square to any of you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cozy, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kolC
Reviews.Content: Loved our short stay. Close to major shopping, eating and public transport. Rooms were great.... would have loved one with a better view... because we saw neither sun, nor skyline. Conceirge was great and helpful, a little humility couldnt hurt though. We checked our luggage with the bellboy, after we checked out of the hotel since our flight wasnt until late evening and it was very convenient. Parking is exorbitant....park at the garage next door for less than half their price! Or better still use public transport.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Basilico
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights mid-week during the end of February. The room was very attractive, the bedding was comfy, the service staff and front desk excellent. We were in room 901 and can say that we experienced none of the "noise" referred to in a few other reviews. Was quiet as a graveyard on the ninth floor. The breakfast in the hotel downstairs (from 6:30 to 9:30 a.m.) offered about as much as you could eat. The omlette guy will make whatever you want; i enjoyed the fresh fruits and varied pastries. At the corner of Sutter and Powell streets, you're in the midst of everything with the Chinatown gate three blocks away, the top-end shops near Union Square four blocks away, and one of the trolley lines passes right up Powell Street beside the hotel. Also: I think it noteworthy to mention that I left a jacket behind in our room upon departure. Noticing the missing item upon returning home, I called the hotel to ask if they had it. They did and it was kindly and quickly shipped all the way back to Maryland within 4 days. The icing on the cake of that story is that the housekeeping staff was very pleasant in accommodating my special request.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Jasonboo2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. I asked for a high floor because I knew union square gets loud. We were on the 22nd floor and slept like babies. I am sure the lower floors are much louder. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our TV did not work at first. We notified the staff and it was fixed when we got back to our room. The rooms were clean and the A/C worked great. The hotel is in a great location 5 blocks from the bart and right on the trollie stop. We walked to the warf from the hotel in about 35 minutes. I would recommend this hotel. I did not get a chance to check out the gym and other amenities. They also recommended a great wine tour in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that double charges-customer service be damned.”
Reviews.Author: a_kanoria
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott from Jan 15th to 18th. The stay itself was uneventful and the rooms and facilities were average. The location was useful. At check-in I was asked for my credit card as a guarantee even though it was agreed that payment would be settled in cash on check out. This was duly done. But 3 weeks later my credit card bill showed up with a one night debit for the night already paid. When I called the Front Desk I was informed that the hotel does not have an e-mail and I should fax whatever I wished to say. Fax followed on Feb 11th and as on Feb 16th there is no response from the hotel, nor any effort to refund the double charge. So much for customer service. So be careful with the plastic you dish out here....

Reviews.Title: “Needs an attitude adjustment”
Reviews.Author: ChocoholicSydney
Reviews.Content: Our experience didn't get off to a good start. We had reserved our room 3 months prior to our stay, had paid in full at that time, had a voucher and confirmation for our stay, but the hotel had no record of our reservation. This kind of thing happens and I completely understand that it can cause problems in what may normally be an efficient check-in system. However, when things go wrong that are so obviously the fault of the hotel, I have certain expectations - the least of which is an apology. What we got was a long and frustrating check-in experience which included the constant re-typing of our names into their compuer system and the handing over of an inch-thick printout which we were asked to look through to see if we could find our names. Honestly - there were thousands and thousands of names in there for all sorts of different reservation periods and although the names were listed alphabetically within each list there were hundreds of lists (not related to reservation period as far as I could tell). After getting off a long flight, this isn't what you want to be doing for half an hour or more! Eventually we were told that we'd be treated as "walk-ins" but wouldn't be charged. Gee thanks for that. All I can say is that our experience should act as a deterrent to anyone who actually wants to "walk-in" and expect a decent reception! For our "sins" we were assigned to what my husband referred to as the janitor's closet on the lowest level of the hotel. I can fully endorse the other comments that talk about the plumbing noises and noise from the fitness centre. The funniest aspect of our room was that the closet was so small that the double sliding doors were each more than three quarters as wide as the closet - so there was hardly enough room to fit your arm through the gap when it was open at its widest! When we asked to change rooms the next morning (we had booked a king room but had ended up in a twin) the best I can say about the attitude is "rude and very begrudging". We were informed that there were no king rooms available, nor any queen rooms so we were stuck with the twin beds but still wanted to move to a less noisy location. You'd think we'd asked the woman at reception to hand over her firstborn! Eventually we were grudgingly given a new room - only a couple of floors higher (so definitely none of the views that had been described by others on this site) but at least it had a more standard layout (could actually open the cupboard doors for example) and it was quieter - only the traffic noise to contend with. Naturally we had to move our own luggage! In summary, the location of this hotel can't be faulted, nor can the housekeeping. The rest of the staff need an attitude adjustment and the rooms could definitely do with some soundproofing.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: lulupitt
Reviews.Content: The front desk was great. When we requested early check-in, there was a huge line of other people checking-in so our hope was not high. But the front desk person was very efficient and moved us to a large corner room (I think it was a handicap-access room). The room was great and huge for San Francisco. I love the bed at Marriott. The view was limited by the building across the street but not too bad. Overall, it was nice and convenient place to stay. We had a great time! The only thing that would make it better would be a business center with free printer and computers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but some employees not so well-trained”
Reviews.Author: LynnDB
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 spent four nights from December 31-January 4. We had 2 connecting rooms. The rooms were gorgeous with large bathrooms that were marble and had a separate tub and shower. Beds were amazing. Our problems were with some of the staff. The concierge was under-staffed with long lines of guests waiting for help. In the restaurant for breakfast, each of us (5) ordered a pot of tea. The waiter brought us one minature 2 inch pitcher of milk for the tea. After the first two people used the milk, the container was empty. Our 12 year old daughter then asked the waiter if we could have 2 more containers of milk. He told her in a scolding manner that he would bring her one more and then if we needed more, we could ask for it!! I was shocked! And this happened at a Marriott! Overall, a fantastic hotel with many good employees. There is that old saying "a few bad apples....."

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully remodeled Mariott”
Reviews.Author: JaniceWa
Reviews.Content: The most comfortable bed I have ever slept in was at this Marriott. It was luxury. The room was nicely appointed, although the bathroom was TINY, the rest of the room experience made up for it. I would recommend it and I would stay there again. My only hesitation is in reporting the snooty attitude of some of the front desk staff. I have stayed other Marriotts and have not encountered this before.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: maryandhumphrey
Reviews.Content: Loved location; easy walk to Union Square and restaurants (and I was wearing a walking cast!!) King room gorgeous (2 sizes of king-ask for "large king"), quiet , smallish bath with great amenities, free fridge on request. Bath not quite clean (dust); pillows not great (ask for foam if you like support); room lighting very dim. Staff very friendly and efficient. Parking expensive (use adjacent garages for half the price) 4-5 blocks from BART.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: rob3066
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hotel early afternoon having decided to move from a previously booked Hotel. The Staff were great found us a room on the 19th Floor with views of Nob Hill and partly of the Bay. The rates were very good value and included Executive Lounge access on 2 days. The public areas on the ground floor are large and well furnished. Our room was a King not too large but certainly adequate, the views as mentioned were quite good for downtown San Francisco. The room was well furnished, almost new, very clean with a smallish bathroom. It did suffer somewhat from noise from the room above, more from the bathroom than anything going on the in bedroom. The whole Hotel seemed well adapted for 4 star accomodation. Every member of Staff we came across was very warm and helpful, from the Bar Staff, the Door Staff to the Reception Staff. The Hotel is about 5 mins walk from Union Square, just one block away and is on the corner of Powell Street, therefore easy access to the Cable Cars. You could walk to Market Street for the Trolley buses in 15 mins easy. Never used the Bart so cannot say how far that was. We did not have dinner at the Hotel, we did try the breakfast in the Executive lounge but found Lori's Diner on the opposite side of Powell Street to be our preferred choice. I know we didn't pay for the Exec Lounge, which is probably a good job, because having stayed at many similar Hotels in the Marriott chain and other chains, we found the Executive lounge of poor value. Only open for breakfast and the evening, yes you did get access to a computer and internet free (internet was otherwise quite expensive), breakfast was complimentry but not a wonderful selection available, and evening snacks were very small in size and small in quantity and yes you could have free soft drinks and coffee but the glass of wine came with a cost of $8 per glass. We did use the bar are most evenings, quite unusually, because it seemed so relaxing with great attentive staff. There was parking and valet parking available at the hotel which we didn't use, I don't know the costs. Overall, excellant, 4 star accommodation and very good rates very close to a popular part of San Francisco. To get to the airport at the end of our stay, we had a private limo hire (Town Car, they call it) for $38 plus tips. Took about 30 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in SFO”
Reviews.Author: JimNielslen
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I have stayed in for quite a while. Staff was attentive, room was immaculate, linens were clean, bed was extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: data08
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in Union Square, conveniently within walking distance to many places of interest. Cable car to and from Fisherman's Wharf is right outside of the hotel. Nice respectful staff, clean hotel. NO free internet.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place in SF”
Reviews.Author: JohnMD
Reviews.Content: I travel for business a fair amount, and I generally try to stay at places that are preferred by our company. In the bay area, these have included hotels such as Park 55, the JW Marriott, the Hilton, and the Oakland Marriott. I watched the transformation of the Crowne Plaza/480 Hotel to the Marriott and was an early guest of the hotel this spring. It is now fully functioning and is really quite perfect for the business traveler for the following reasons: close access to BART... just a five minute walk; nice functioning rooms.... the Coit tower/bay view rooms are outstanding (small but well appointed and comfortable); the executive lounge is fine... not over the top but the staff are friendly and the selection of food and beverages good.... breakfast is above average; the bar lounge is outstanding for the solo traveler.... drinks and food outstanding and prices quite reasonable; staff are courteous, friendly, and respectful; design and decorations very modern and appealing; location to shopping and restaurants excellent. I have stayed at the Palace, the Ritz, the St. Francis, and many others that are more historic and have bigger rooms, but the Marriott Union Square for the money is the best value in town and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Refined in all ways without pretensions”
Reviews.Author: mommy4eyes
Reviews.Content: This is undeniably the best location in the city and the hotel has no shortcomings. The doorman graciously greets you and the staff is intelligent and competent. I would stay here again whenever given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “US west coast highlight 14 days”
Reviews.Author: HenryW3
Reviews.Content: great location at Union Square, surrounding hotel spreads with shopping centre likes; Macy's, Bloombing Dale's, easy to catch train go to Fisherman Wharf, we spend several hour in Union Square till midnight, waitting count down change New year 97

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: YvieD
Reviews.Content: The Marriott in San Francisco was absolutely fabulous - It made our trip to San Francisco worthwhile for their service, comfort and excellent style. Their standards are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Peitro1
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel in San Francisco. You can take Bart train from airpot to Powell Union Square station and within the walking distant to the hotel. You never have to worry about rental car parking, it has great service, and very close to all shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaL81
Reviews.Content: This newly renovated hotel was wonderful. It felt more like a W Hotel than a Marriott. The rooms were huge for San Francisco and the location was great. The decor was wonderful, beds were super comfy, and the bathroom was luxurious. Great hotel, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, close to shopping.”
Reviews.Author: wendic
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter, her friend and her friends mom decided to do a short, one night trip to San Francisco. We stayed here only because we were able to get a family rate due to my friends son works with an affiliate hotel. Being that the rooms normally go for $250 on up, I might not stay there again. But, it was a very nice hotel in a great location. We walked to China Town and the Westfield Mall. Very close to buses and trolley car. The rooms were typical Marriott, very spacious and comfy beds. You can always count on Marriott for consistancy! We got good info and directions at the front desk too. There are many other hotels that I think would be less expensive in this area but, again, you can always count on Marriott to be good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: REEMaryland
Reviews.Content: Service was the best feature at the Marriott Union Square. While checking in (early), I asked for a quiet room and was moved to an "interior" room. I ended up in an alcove at the end of the hall, overlooking an adjacent rooftop. Even there, the view was fine. More importantly, it was very quiet. I heard almost no hall noise or street noise nor did I hear any TV from adjacent rooms. It was quite impressive for a center-city location. I also got excellent recommendations for a quick lunch and sushi dinner that were within a short walk. BART was also an easy walk. The location isn't especially unique--there are many downtown hotels in downtown SF. I was most impressed with the desk staff helping another guest check in. The woman behind the desk was patient and calm while the guest was stressed. Within the time it took me to print my boarding pass, they solved the problem to the guests delight. Cleanliness was excellent throughout. Also, the rooms have many of the most modern amenities, including panel to connect electronics to the wide screen TV, lots of convenient outlets for recharging, an MP3-ready clock radio, and an ethernet cable ready on the desk (no in-room wireless). Like most hotels in its category, there is a modest fee for internet connectivity. Kudos for the dual flush toilets. The hotel wasn't "perfect", but it was solid. The imperfections: I couldn't find a pool, but that was not a bid deal for me. My young daughter would probably have been bored here, but it was a solid business hotel, probably a 10 minute walk to the convention center. There is no Starbucks in the hotel, but there is one across the street and one about every other block around SF, so it wasn't a problem getting caffeine in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but average hotel...”
Reviews.Author: bellarinna
Reviews.Content: We love Marriott Hotels and love staying in the city. We've stayed in numerous Marriott Hotels, including one in Europe. I decided to book this hotel (Marriott Hotel in Fourth St) for 2 nights to celebrate my birthday with my family. I heard that they recently renovated and was excited to celebrate here. The location is ideal, but the rooms are a letdown. I guess I was expecting much more. Pretty basic room and I really can't say much about the bathroom. If I plan to stay in the city, I definitely won't choose Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room.”
Reviews.Author: Swansing
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with a great location. You are one block from the shopping district, a block from Whole Foods, close walking distance to Chinatown and the major museums and galleries and less than a block from the streetcar to Fisherman's Wharf. The public transportation system is great as there is a subway about a block away as well and always tons of cabs waiting outside the hotel if needed. We fell in love with San Francisco, and our room at the Marriot, while not cheap, had a great view and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in away from home. It had a feather bed and a down comforter and pillows. The fitness centre was well-equipped and I recommend this hotel if you want a clean and comfortable stay in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations make the difference for the meeting space”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for those attending conferences at Moscone West. Nicely located, there are several restaurants and bars nearby, with the shopping just a few blocks away. When I stayed here in 2005, the meeting space on the second and third floors was maze-like. The new renovations opened up the areas so now, the rooms are much much easier to locate. Because I was staying for 10 days, I was fortunate enough to get a larger corner room. I needed it considering the number of deliveries I had for the conference! The room was spacious and clean, and housekeeping did a nice job. However, shipping/receiving "lost" several of my packages, including perishable goods. I hosted two meetings at the hotel and the staff was fantastic to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every respect”
Reviews.Author: DavidBradley
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night while on business, but I thoroughly enjoyed this Marriott. As others have mentioned, the location is very convenient to great shopping, restaurants, sight-seeing, and public transportation. BART is an easy three blocks away, cable car is one block away. The Marriott re-design of this hotel is very well done; the loung and lobby areas are quite stylish without being stuffy. Service was very good. The exercise facility was good, with a fair amount of space, a lot of treadmills, some free weights, and some weight machines. I only ate breakfast in the restaurant. Overall, this hotel works very well for business, shoppers, or tourists. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, nice hotel. Location is just great.”
Reviews.Author: todebald
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights and got a a nice and new room on a high floor. The room was adequately equipped, very clean. So was the bathroom. Both beds were equally comfortable. As said by another traveller, the room lacks a safe deposit box and a fridge. I was not bothered by any noise whatsoever. Having this said, the hotel appeared to be fairly empty. Overall, service was average, not really caring except for breakfast. As to breakfast, it was average as well - good omelet though. Fitness room is nice and well equipped. The greatest asset of that hotel is certainly the location, right in the center of Union Square and close to anything one would need - cable cars, shops, busses etc.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MBerryBolton_England
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights this month and can highly recommend it. Perfect location for all transport - we used the BART from the airport to get here and was just a short walk from the station. Door staff and bell boys excellent, but the desk staff could do with being a bit more personable and attentive - we tried to use the airport check-in terminal next to the front desk, and were clearly struggling, but the man on the desk was too busy on his phone arranging a weekend with his girlfreind and booking his flights to help us! Our room was perfect - we had a corner family room on 18th floor with windows on 2 sides overlooking Macey's and Sutter Street - just fab! The downside is that the bar is WAY too expensive - $9 for a Gin and Tonic!!! Not every guest is loaded with money! MInd you, just down the street opposite Union Square is a GREAT bar - looks very seedy from the outside, but excellent inside called Gold Dust Lounge. We got the 3 dat MUNI pass and used it many times over to get all over the city. As for car parking charges, you really don't need a car - we dropped out hire car back before we went into the city - and didn't miss it at all.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhiJK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mariott Union Square in Mid-August and were quite happy with that choice. Clean, big rooms, very comfortable beds, nice interior, friendly personell. The location is quite in the middle of everything. CableCar stops right at the edge of the hotel buidling, Mall and Downtown a short walk away and Chinatown begins right 2 blocks behind the hotel. I would advise parking at the nearby garage, as it is much cheaper than valet at the hotel, especially Sundays.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: irishinealing
Reviews.Content: I do the Marriott for one important reason - you always know what you're going to get. This was no exception. Nice hotel, nice room. Bathroom was stupidly tiny and there was no full length mirror in room but other than that, excellent. Great location, I strongly recommend Union Square. Lots of bars and restaurants around the area. Good luck getting on the cable car, we bought a three day pass and did not successfully board once, it is constantly packed. We caught the bus a few times. We mostly walked everywhere. Beautiful city. Pacific Heights is gorgeous. Cow Harbour is divine, loved it. Hated Fishermans Wharf, it's full of cheap cr*p, total waste of space. HATED it. Alcatraz was excellent. Lombard street was just so charming, well worth the hike up one mother of a hill. I lost weight in SF! Walk to North Beach from Union Square, through Chinatown, you get some really good views of city. Go to Vesuvio bar next to the Citylights bar, it's where Jack Kerouac and other 'beat generation' names used to hang out apparently - we had a good time there! Ate in a very good restaurant, can't remember the name, it's recommended in the Lonely Planet.

Reviews.Title: “Should not be allowed to be called a Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KikiHancock
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Marriott Hotel I have stayed in. The plumbing is heard all night - sounded like my neighbors' bathroom was next to my pillow. There was no valet when we pulled up so we had to keep circling the block until we could pull up, quickly unload our bags, then my husband went looking for parking - not easy in SF/Union Square. We were guaranteed a top floor and they tried to put me on the lowest floor - I did win that battle. The topper was when I called Marriott help they transferred me to a customer service center that was closed!! This should really be marketed as a Motel 6 - but without the price benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: Sun_worshipper_2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Union Square for 4 days. The property is newly renovated. The lobby is very nice, modern and spacious. The room was beautiful, large, and completely renovated. We paid for a junior suite and access to the conceirge lounge, which was basically a full servie breakfast. The fitness room is large and has all new equipment. The location (as many have noted) can't be beat: one block to Union Sq; Cable car stops at the corner, short walk to Chinatown. We will stay here again when we return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lespres
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for our four day stay in San Francisco. The central location made it very convenient to the trolley and excellent shopping in Union Square. We were able to walk or catch public transit to Chinatown as well as all of the tourist and cultural sites in the city including Fisherman's Wharf. The concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Might be my new favorite SF Marriott ...”
Reviews.Author: MarriottGuySanDiego
Reviews.Content: As someone who travels to SF maybe four times a year, I've become quite content staying at the Marriott property on 55 Fourth Street, the full-service Marriott. It's easy to get to off the BART and close to everything. Just for kicks, I decided to stay at the newly-converted Union Square Marriott up on Powell (you know, before the hills get REALLY steep). Loved it. Got a great room (2801), one of, I'm told, only six in the hotel that has a sweeping view of Coit Towers, the bay and is a really large room with a separate living room, bedroom and a bathroom that's two rooms (big shower, vanity and then toilet bath/shower). The concierge lounge is huge and has views on the other side looking out toward Union Square and downtown. We had wine/beer in the lobby but opted to eat elsewhere (so should you, it's SF!). Unsure on parking, but you don't need to be driving in this city anyway. Close to everything, Starbucks across the street. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel in unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: G_in_LA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple nights and the room was nice and new. It was on the 28th floor and well insulated from the cable cars and sounds of the gay parade down the street. You can easily walk to everything from this location, so you don't need a car. Only negatives were: room needs a fridge and safe, and the concierge-level happy hour charges ridiculous prices for beer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Ok Value, Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: Lara67
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel 480, now the Marriott Union Square, on two occasions, before and after the rooms were updated. Both times were on business (conference at the Moscone Center), and both were at a special conference rate that is a considerable deal over the best available internet rate. The renovation had taken care of some issues over the previous stay, specifically that the rooms are now updated and everything was beautiful and in good working order. I also liked the fact that the property is now non-smoking, as my previous room was a little smoky, even though I had a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor. So, in those respects itâ€™s much improved. I always found the rooms to be very spacious and sunny. The previous stay was in a two double bed room which was extremely spacious, especially for San Francisco. Two people traveling together would be very comfortable in that room. Itâ€™s also very conveniently located near public transportation. The Powell BART station is four blocks south. I always schlep my luggage from the station, which can be a little tricky given the crowds in Union Square. So, folks with bulkier baggage may wish to catch a cab. Once there, it is however super easy, fast and cheap to take BART to SFO. I did unfortunately find the walls to be thin and subsequently the room during my second stay was noisy. There was loud door/drawer slamming/banging going on the first night of my second stay which awakened me early in the morning. A call to the front desk put a stop to that, but there was still significant noise transfer to a lesser degree throughout my stay. Given that, I would be inclined to try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: dnolan36
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel mainly because of its location and the deal we got on the room. It is nice that it is located directly on the cable car route. The service and all the employees were very nice and courteous. The room that we had was nice and cozy. The room we had was more on the small side. It made good use of the space but it could have been a bit bigger for the price. The bed in the room is one of the most comfortable I have had for a hotel. There were a few negatives to this hotel. When we were there the hotel bar was being remodeled. A few times I wanted to go down to have a drink but I could not because the bar was closed. The second problem was the bathroom was very small. There is no way that two people could get ready or go in the bathroom at the same time. My last complaint is that the internet is not free. For what it cost to stay in hotels of this class I would like to have free internet. I think the internet was around $12.00 a day which is a little high.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rohitag
Reviews.Content: For the Amount of money paid and the service received I was more than satisfied .

Reviews.Title: “Should improve when renovations are completed in June”
Reviews.Author: FancyNancyBoston
Reviews.Content: We knew from reviews that the lobby was undergoing renovations, but there was no business center or bar or comfortable lounging area. None of this was highlighted by the hotel on booking with Marriott. We selected the hotel for its location - perfect to get almost anywhere via cable car, BART, bus or walking and it was a Marriott property. Had originally booked the Stanford Court on Nob Hill but needed to cancel due to a knee injury (too much climbing with a bum knee). Desk staff and bell men were pleasant and helpful. We avoided the concierge because of previous reviews, as well as floors 6 through 8 (noisy). My husband used the fitness center and found it very adequate. Guest rooms are newly updated and a bit sterile, but not unpleasant. All the comments about the size of the bathrooms are right on. Smallest bath since Paris I think. I thought the price was very reasonable for downtown SF, probably more so during the renovations. A Walgreen's across the street provided snacks & other essentials - clearly geared to the foreign tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated rooms and common areas”
Reviews.Author: DrJJBaltimore_MD
Reviews.Content: Very nice, newly renovated hotel with style of renovation similar to Marriott Renaissance Hotel Brand. Excellent front desk and housekeeping services. Great location just north of Union Square on Powell, right on cable car line. Bathrooms a bit small, but well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: JustMeTexas
Reviews.Content: AWESOME location for someone visiting for the first time! We picked this hotel based on the reviews from trip advisor and we were extremely satisfied. We were within walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go (we like to walk). If this is your first visit to San Francisco, DON'T RENT A CAR. You will not need it. I also recommend taking a guided bus tour your first day so you can decide where you want to go back and spend more time at. We LOVED the shopping in Chinatown! We're already planning a return trip for November because 5 nights was not enough for us. I see a lot of comments on the front desk and i can say personally, I was neither impressed or disappointed with them. The gentlemen at the Bell Desk were very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jillyv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of April. The room was lovely and very clean and was situated on the 23rd floor, with views of the shops in Union Square. Excellent location for getting around San Francisco. Close to Chinatown and lots of nearby restaurants. Cable car line passes by and stops just across the road on the corner of Powell and Sutter. The staff on both the front desk and the bellmen were all very friendly and helpful. The conceirge also gave good advice with regard to transport in the area. Only two gripes, no personal safe in the room, (although safety deposit boxes were available downstairs, however this is a bit of an inconvenience). plus there wasn't a bar in the hotel at the time of our stay. This I believe should be rectified sometime in June if the notices posted in the hotel are correct. If you don't wish to have breakfast in the Marriott Lori's Diner on the opposite corner is a good place for breakfast (but be prepared to queue, it is very busy). There is also a starbucks right opposite. Overall a very nice hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Full-Service Marriott, but ...”
Reviews.Author: PDXBigGuy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay. Very pleasant, low-key, quiet, boutique-like. ROOM: New and spiffy, "Compact" bathroom didn't bother me. Most glaring omission: NO SAFE in a brand-new Marriott: unforgivable and unbelievable. Flat-panel TV with analog signal; why don't you make the internet connection dial-up to go along with the fuzzy TV picture. By the way, no HBO, but STARZ, which turned out to be FOX Business Channel. Note to management: give us real coffee mugs instead of WASTEFUL paper cups in the room! CONCIERGE LOUNGE: very nice, roomy, high quality food but limited selections consistent with recent downgrades across the country. Closed Saturday, reopened Sunday late afternoon. GYM: new Life Fitness treadmills (6) , striders (3), and bikes (3); all with TV's. A water fountain (instead of the current dispenser) would save all the throwaway cups. Aren't you Californians suppose to be more environmentally-aware? LOCATION: probably the best feature. Close to most tourist traps (cable cars, shopping, Chinatown)

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: angelinem1
Reviews.Content: We arrived Friday evening, gave the car to valet, and began a fantastic weekend. I asked the front desk clerk, Andres, for a room facing Coit Tower and was rewarded with a wonderful corner room on the 19th floor with a view of the Bay and the Powell Street hill so we could see the cable cars going up and down. The hotel is small, has no bar which would be a wonderful asset, but hey, there are great bars and restaurants within steps of the hotel which is corner of Powell and Sutter. Only real minus are the very small bathrooms with little counter space for toiletries, but we made it work. Service was superb overall. Hotel newly renovated so the rooms are clean and well appointed. We asked for a late check out Sunday morning and were given until 2 P.M. so we were able to go down to the Ferry Building for a wonderful breakfast and some shopping in the indoor Ferry Building marketplace.

Reviews.Title: “First Review of complete Renovation- Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: TravelSnob1
Reviews.Content: HOTEL REVIEW # 170 Marriott Union Square MY TRAVEL STYLE: If possible, I try to stay away from business hotels and strongly prefer resorts that resemble the Four Seasons, Aman, and Oberoi but try to find similar properties at lower cost. I seek out the â€œwowâ€� experiences and I encourage you to view hotels I have stayed at and their respective reviews (by clicking on my name). LOCATION: Excellent. A few blocks from the shopping of Union Square and the nightlife on Geary street. TYPE OF ROOM: Standard Room. BED/SHEETS/PILLOW: Excellent bed, high quality linens, and perfect down pillows. LIGHTING: Good lighting in bedroom and bathroom. BATHROOM/SHOWER: This is the downside of the room. The bathroom is tiny and there is barely room to put a toiletry bag. They did a good job with the space but it is so small. The shower has good water pressure and can be made consistently hot if desired. TOILETRIES: Bed & Bath productsâ€¦. Very good. CLEANLINESS: Hotel is 3 days old and very clean. A/C: Didnâ€™t use CLOSET SPACE: Average size, but may be too small for 2 people to unpack all items. STYLE OF ROOM: Very comfortable room and some nice style. COMMON AREA: Lobby is small and not really a place to hang out. Looks like a hip boutique hotel as opposed to a Marriott. QUIET/MORNING LIGHT: Room was exceptionally quiet but could hear a loud car go by occasionally. Definitely worth getting a high floor for less street noise. FOOD: Room service food quality was mediocre. TV/INTERNET: TV has many channels. Internet is available for $12.95 SERVICE: Staff are nice. One person sent me the wrong direction making me late for a meeting in the city. SUMMARY:Definitely one of the best Marriott experiences since it is brand new, looks less like a Marriott and more like a boutique hotel. I have also stayed at the W and the Monaco, and this will be my top choice now in the $200 hotel range. If you are ok with a tiny bathroom, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Friendly Service, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: gwilliams
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights in February - reception was very friendly and offered a choice of rooms. The room was very large and comfortable, and the daily service left it immaculate. The lobby area is still under renovations, but that may be why the price was so good. The hotel location is outstanding if you want to be downtown (one block from Union Square) and as it is on the tram line it is easy to get around. The tram line adds a little noise if your room is lower down, but the rooms are well insulated for sound, so that wasn't a problem. For my stay the room was less than $100 U.S. a night...very hard to beat. Did not use the restaurant, but there are good breakfast places nearby, and who wants to eat in a hotel when you are in a city with so many good restaurants?

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE EVER!”
Reviews.Author: KainaluHi
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews my husband booked a room here over another hotel he stayed at previously. I can't believe the clean, stylish rooms at the room rate we paid. There is still renovations going on in the lobby and exterior, probably the reason for the low room rate. But this was definitely the best by for our $. Hopefully the roomrates are still affordable on our next trip back to SF. Walgreens, Diner and Starbucks right across the street. Right on the cable car run. Great staff and service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: JoVNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 25-Feb-2009 to 4-Mar-2009 and would like to highlight the excellent customer service we received from all the staff but especially Diana (front-desk), James (bellman) and the 2 concierges. We also had reservations at the J W Marriott but at the last minute based on reviews at this site decided to make reservations here instead. Yes, the hotel was still undergoing some renovations but we were not inconvenienced by it. The service, the large room, comfortable beds and location more than made up for it. I was travelling with my 73-year-old Mother and was worried beforehand about the how far the hotel was to the shopping area but in the end she found the short walk a breeze and was making several trips back to the hotel a day to unload her shopping bags. I also used the fitness center everyday and it was more than adequate. The TV screen on each cardio machine made my workout more enjoyable. Jo NZ

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a great location with brand new rooms and friendlt staff”
Reviews.Author: MikeStanton
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel after reading reports on here. We wanted a centrally located hotel reasonably priced with a nice room with a view. We got more than expected! We arrived at the Hotel 480 after our ten hour flight to a clean but rather dated lobby, the concierge explaned that the 'new' lobby was next door under wraps and they would be moving there in the next few days, something that happened during our stay. We were shown to our room on the 21st floor. The room was of a good size, brand new, totally refurbished it smelled of new carpet and fresh plaster! The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was classy with marble tops and once again all new bath/shower wc. The 32' flat screen TV had 30 something channels including the all important weather channel. On to the Location. The hotel 480 sits convienently on the corner of Sutter and Powell, where the cable car,(like a tram but pulled by an underground cable) runs right outside! to both Union square (1 block) and the Westfield shopping mall one way and the other way to Fishermans Wharf. Also various buses run along Sutter and Geary (1 block away). There is a drug store on the opposite corner and Loris Diner. The only negatives were that due to the renovations the bar and restaurant had to close whilst we were there to be relocated with the new lobby. Room service during this time was only available for Breakfast. This for us this was a minor inconvience as there were plenty of places to eat/drink within a few minutes walk. I also tried the gym which had all new life fitness machines! We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better, but still not there yet”
Reviews.Author: travelbee28
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel 480 two years in a row for a 2-day conference. The renovations are superb. The rooms are now modern and much more comfortable than my 2008 visit. The hotel is also very affordable. Cleanliness, however, does not seem to be their forte. I'll spare the details, but suffice it to say that the cleaning crew could do a much better job (and should probably wear hair nets)!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The 480!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelSacramento
Reviews.Content: If you have read the earlier reviews I can tell you that everyone was dead on about the 480. The 480 is located at "480" Sutter Street. Very easy to remember where your hotel is when the name of the hotel is where the hotel is. Brought the family to S.F. for the Chinese New Year Parade and festivities. We were only 1 block from the parade and of course very close to all of the festivities. I liked everything about our room. The beds were very comfortable. There was a nice, thick comfy bedspread with 4 pillows on each bed. We had a flat screen tv but didn't really have much time to watch it. There is a nice alcove that holds a small coffee pot for coffee/tea. The headboard has two reading lights as mentioned below. The colors/decorating were very nice. The bathroom has a light in the shower if you want to just have it on so as to not disburb other family members sleeping when showering. (The bathroom has a frosted glass sliding door so I was concerned the light might be too bright). We were unsure as to where the parking garage was for the hotel and ended up parking in another lot which I understand was quite a bit less expensive. We ran into the cleaning lady in the hall in the morning and she was very nice. The bellmen/doormen were very nice, friendly and helpful.
