The next time we come back to S.F. we will definetely stay at the 480. And this time it will be longer than just one night. Kudos 480 for a very nice job on the renovation and for the friendly and helpful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: liljro
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with two beds but when we checked-in they had none available so they upgraded us to a Jr. Suite which was sweet. The rooms are big & nice especially the bathroom. The hotel smells brand new but the only problem was the exterior of the hotel which is undergoing construction. We did not hear any construction; this is a great place plus it's located near Union Square. We will definately stay there again but beware the parking is $46 per day however, there is a parking garage right next to it which is cheaper for only $30. I would recommend to park there instead.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem! It is now on my favorite list.”
Reviews.Author: lvtravelngirl
Reviews.Content: I was first attracted to this hotel because it was in my price range; I heard SF was very expensive so being my first time, I was happy to find a hotel until $150 a night (I actually got it for $110/night). From the minute I arrived, I could not have picked a better hotel! The staff was friendly. I arrived at 7:30 a.m. (well, before check in) but Chris had a room for me within minutes. And what a room it was!! The other desk clerk seemed friendly and the concierge, bell hops and doormen were AWESOME!!! They always had a warm greeting and a smile on their face; very accommodating and helpful! My room was AWESOME!!! It didn't have the best view, but it wasn't horrible either- I was in room 1203. It was great because it had it's own little alcove entrance. The room was pretty big (king bed) and I immediately fell in love with the colors and decor. The bathroom is tiny in size, but also liked how it was decorated. The water pressure was perfect!! Maybe even a bit too much for the faucet at the sink. The toiletries are from Bath & Body Works. I loved the headboard on the bed-- it had two little reading lights that gave just enough light to read, but not enough to disturb the person on the other side of the bed. They now have flat screen tvs in the rooms. There was a nice sitting area (chair/ottoman) near the bay window in my room. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!! I don't think there is a better spot in the entire city. It is less than 100 ft from the Powell/Hyde trolley and has a Starbuck's on one corner and a Walgreen's on the other. There were a lot of dining options in any direction once you walked outside. As far as the renovation is concerned, the only thing I noticed is that the front (the facade) is covered and there is scaffolding at the entrance of the hotel. I never heard any construction noise (but.. I wasn't in my room during the day). I was not at all inconvenienced or troubled by the renovation-- I can't wait to go back when they are done to see what it's going to look like! A small, but sort of important note: The elevators were very quick! I never had to wait more than a few seconds. Very nice when you come back and all you want to do is go rest in your room. I have been in hotels that I have had to wait more than 10 minutes for an elevator. I was traveling on my own (single female) and always felt safe in the hotel and in the surrounding area. Again, it was great that the trolley stop was basically right outside the hotel entrance. Some travel tips if you go: 1. Get a Go San Francisco card! I saved over $50 on attractions- I paid $79 for a 3 day pass and did: Wine Country tour , biked the bridge to Sausalito , City Bus Tour, Wax Museum, and the Alcatraz tour. You can purchase online, in advance. 2. Grayline tours (and probably all tours): Definitely ask for a DETAILED description of the actual tour. I took two Grayline tours (they were on my GoCard) and neither one really matched the brochure description. The City Bus tour and the Wine Country Tour. 3. I was told not to miss going to Scoma's and Boudin's for lunch/dinner. Both places were ok, but not worth the $$. I had Fish and Chips at Scoma's (Sausalito)- $24- way overpriced and nothing special. To be fair to Boudin's, I did NOT have the chowder; I had Jumbo Shrimp and Chips ($24.95)- the shrimp was tasty but again, not worth the money. 4. Get a pass for the trolley, MUNI, cable car system-- very convenient instead of having to carry around change and/or money for the fares. A 3 day pass (which I bought at Walgreen's) was $18. 5. If you are looking for the Real World San Francisco house, it's at 953 Lombard (not on the crooked section-- it's between Leavenworth and Jones and.. it's a very steep walk back up to Hyde- where the crooked street begins!) Again, I cannot wait to go back so I can stay at Hotel 480 again. It seemed like they had a lot of return customers. Each time I spent more than 5 minutes in the lobby (waiting for shuttles/tour buses), people were constantly saying Hi to the employees using their first names. It reminded me a bit of Cheers- where everyone knew each others names. I had nothing but an amazing experience at Hotel 480 and highly recommend it! (Definitely check out the discount hotel sites- hotels.com, travelocity, etc. for a reasonable rate-- I was happy to get it for $110 a night, but feel it's worth at least $200-$250!)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel - best bargain for a 4+ star in SF-Enjoy it while you can”
Reviews.Author: PVTraveler01
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel when it was the Crown Plaza. Location is absolutely the best - 1 block from Union Squuare .. Rumor has it that once the exterior and lobby renovation is complete, it will be reflagged as the Union Square Marriott. The interior and room renovations are complete and the qualtiy is outstanding. I got a rate that is probably abpout 1/3 of what you will pay once the Marriott flag goes up and is easily 50-75% below comaparable quality hotels in the area. The front of the building is being renovated so it's all boarded up and there is a warning about noise. However, I was on the 20th floor and not once during a four day stay did I hear any noise or have to detour around any work.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, affordable and great location”
Reviews.Author: Smelly_Sock
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel stay for 4 nights about 2 months ahead and got a really good deal through Travelocity for about 88$ per night. The hotel is being renovated, so you cant really see the facade. But, as soon as you enter, its perfect. It's beautifully maintained(everything is brand new). We checked in late at night and the staff was very courteous and helpful. Room service is not 24 hours, that's the only thing you need to watch out for. We asked for and got a room on the 19th floor- away from all the street noise, and with a pretty good view. We had a glimpse of the bay even. The higher floors have even better view but they were still under renovation. The bathroom was clean and housekeeping was excellent. There isn't a business center, but they do have a computer attached to a printer just for printing your boarding passes and checking in online - that's good enough! It's right at the corner of Powell and Sutter - on the cable car line. Getting in at this stop is much better than walking down to union square where the lines are too long. There is a Starbucks right opposite the hotel. Walgreen and Loris diner are right across the street. Everything you could need is a block away at most. I repeat myself, but the location was perfect! Sorry, we forgot to take pics of the room. The bathroom toiletries were from bath and body works. The reception can provide maps and directions to most of the places you would want to visit. Chinatown is just 2 blocks away. Union square is about a block away. I would recommend not driving and parking in SF as the costs are high and public transport is readily available. Most places are a cab drive away at most.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable room--Expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: runtom
Reviews.Content: Our single king room on the 8th floor was large, quiet, and comfortable with a coffee maker but no refrigerator. The room was clean and newly renovated. Bed and sheets were comfortable, but the towels were rough. We only stayed Saturday night, and heard zero construction noise. The room had a large desk and comfortable office chair, but the small light on one side did not provide adequate illumination. I thought the room rate of $134 plus tax was a bargain for the area, but parking was $46 plus $6 tax. The nearby Sutter Stockton garage ($33.50) is an option, especially for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LVfun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel 480 for 2 nights. Great location. The room was newly remodeled so everything was new and clean. The staff were nice and helpful. The couple things I wish were a coffee table and a refrigerator in a room. I would stay at this hotel again and totally recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvlBoston
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonably-priced, safe hotel close to all. This exceeded our expectations. I believe that we had a renovated room, it had that new room smell. The room itself is big and modern, nicely decorated. The bathroom is small but has plenty of shelving for our stuff, though it could have used some more towel hooks. We were on the 18th floor so the view was great, a bit scary looking down. They were doing work but it did not bother us since we were out for most of the day. We could hear noise from the outside but it was not bad, only to be expected when staying in a city. The staff was nice and helpful, I had called prior to check-in with some questions and they were very courteous. The location is convenient and safe, we did run into a few colorful characters but no one bothered us. Having the Walgreens open 24 hours a day was great since our luggage was delayed. There are a ton of both small and large restaurants and cafes within a block or two. The bar in the hotel was empty when we walked by, a bit dark with no view. I had to find a flaw and it was the final day when I went to check my email and there were no computers for guest's use. This would have been nice but it would not keep me from staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: donkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the remodeled rooms for a long weekend (#1105). Very quiet. Staff was helpful. Location was very convenient to the Union Square / Powell street shopping, Very good rate through Travelocity. Yes, you don't have full hotel restaurant options during the remodeling. We didn't miss it a bit with options in the area. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mundane but good location”
Reviews.Author: rihoward
Reviews.Content: Really good location just 100m from Union Square and beside a cable car line. Apart from that the hotel is currently being renovated and this may help the hotel, but it is very mundane. Everything about it was avergae- check in, receptionist and the standard of the room. Would be nice to have in room tea or coffee facilities. If you are staying here, I would recommend asking for a room in a higher floor in order to have a decent view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: reuhl925
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, staff at door and front desk were very friendly. We were orginally given a room with 2 beds but we had booked a king room. They immediately sent someone up to take us and our luggage to a new room which had an amazing view! Excellent location, everything right there. Loris diner across the street was yummy! There is also a Walgreens across the street too...very handy! No complaints when we stayed! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pressgang
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a great hotel, just off Union Square in San Francisco at the end of September. The hotel is being remodelled, is shrouded in scaffolding and missing a restaurant (hence only 4 stars), but the staff were welcoming, the location excellent. Then there was the view. We had a room on the 29th floor facing across the city, giving panoramic views to the bay. The room was a little dated, but the beds were comforatble with new high quality linens and nice smellies in the bathroom. The hotel had an excellent fitness room. We skipped breakfast in the hotel and went to Starbucks or the bagel place just down the road that were both considerably cheaper. Union Square is definately the place to stay if you are a tourist visiting the city. It is close to the shops and restaurants, so is great in the evenings. The hotel is right by the cable car stop so you can go to all the attractions by the bay.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: northwoodsdba
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying at this hotel because I needed a room for a week at short notice - one of those sight-unseen bookings. The hotel itself was very nice. There was construction going on - but it was never intrusive, never a problem. I found the staff to be 50/50 between nice and helpful - and snotty and superior. The lady bartender should be avoided whenever possible. I had a room on the 27th floor with an excellent view towards Coit Tower. The room was large, well appointed, and bed was wonderful. The shower was very nice - and the shower head was high enough for me (I'm 6'4"). The housekeeping crew kept the room immaculate, and they just seemed to pop in at the proper time to straighten things up. The only negative would be juggling the temperature to keep it constant. The hotel was very convenient - Walking distance to the Moscone Center, two blocks to Chinatown, quite a bit of reasonable dining within easy walking distance. If I ever need to stay in that area again - I'd certainly go back to Hotel 480.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my Stay at Hotel 480”
Reviews.Author: dprah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 480 during the 2008 Oracle Open World conference. The check in desk personnel were very welcoming, and my room was great! The hotel is undergoing a major renovation. I think I may have been the first one to stay in my room after it was renovated. In fact they were still working on some rooms on the floor. The room is very large and bright. The windows filled most of one wall. The furnishings were very nice, great colors! The bathroom was well lit and spacious enough. The bed and pillows - were so comfortable. Only odd thing was the lack of a full length mirror. And, $10/day for internet service was a bit steep. Walgreen 's was across the street, and I made several trips for water, diet coke and forgotten items. I would definitely recommend the hotel, and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A rip-off, though I do heart the comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: ncbabyblue717
Reviews.Content: After several nights of inns and motels on my road trip, I was so ready to sleep on a nice fluffy bed with equally fluffy pillows and duvet. Hotel 480 did not disappoint. Check-in was a breeze, and the staff was extremely courteous. The location made it easy to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go, which was great, because who wants to drive in SF? I have no complaints about my experience here; in fact, I would whole-heartedly recommend it to anyone...that is, anyone with deep pockets. Internet access was $10 per day, and parking was approximately $50 a day after taxes. Now, I'm from LA so I'm used to paying premium prices for parking and mandatory valet, but $50 was a sticker shock, even for me. In the end, everything added up to almost $300 a night for a room in a three-star hotel. We had a good experience here, but not THAT good.

Reviews.Title: “Good sized rooms and location shame about the building work!!”
Reviews.Author: LaaLaa352
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel 480 for 3 nights, we had booked 2 separate rooms, upon arrival we could see there was building work taking place externally, when we checked in there was no mention at reception about the work only a note left in the rooms stating work would only happen between 9am and 5pm. Also although check-in was 3pm 1 of our rooms was not ready for over an hour after! Our compensation for the building work was 20% off a diner across the road which we first thought was great until we got our Map of the area to only find that anyone could get 20% of so we didn't feel that satisfied. Overall though the rooms were very good size and well equipped, we stayed on the 23rd floor facing towards Fisherman's Wharf so had a great view . Although the building work was happening we were not in much during the day, I think twice we heard the drilling. We just wished we had been informed prior to our arrival. Our overall satisfaction was good but this will be a better hotel when the works are complete.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great price!”
Reviews.Author: dsi999
Reviews.Content: Went to San Fran as a late summer family vacation, and had a great time! As others have stated, this hotel is about a 5 block walk up a very slight hill from the BART station. We stayed at Hotel 480 Sunday through Wednesday, and while downtown we did not have a car, the BART, MUNI and cable cars all provide great access to wherever you want to go. While the hotel was undergoing rennovation during our stay, the only time we noticed any noise was between 9 and 5, and only noticed it when we got off the elevators. We had rooms 2101 and 2102, which was great because we had a little "alcove" that shut our two rooms off from the main hallway. Very private. Walgreens across the street sells passes to cable cars, and you can purchase whatever you forgot to pack! We too ate at Sears, and just 1 block up steep Powell Street is Sontano's Grill, which had a great happy hour, and then Roxanne's Cafe for some great pasta. We never did eat at the hotel; however, when I was speaking to the concierge about some restaurant choices in Napa, the chef did help give his recommendations for downtown SanFran and Napa area. Thursday and Friday we rented a car and drove to the Napa area (stayed in American Canyon) and that was also nice to get out of the city. Muir Woods seemed to "cleanse" us from the noice, hustle and bustle of the city. If you get a chance, go to Hurley's restaurant in Yountville, a family-owned restaurant that has a great heated outdoor patio, good food and great ambiance. Also ate at Cole's Chop House in Napa, good food as well but all ala carte and a bit pricey. Two 50 yr olds and two 21 year olds, and we all had a "favorite day" --Alcatraz, Bike the Bridge (you've got to do this, and have a great lunch in picturesque Sauscilito!), Muir Woods. Definitely worth a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trailblazer44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in a 28th Floor Corner Jr Suite.Large windows overlooking the city and the bay.Room was clean and comfortable when we arrived and was quiet being 2 stories from the top.Hotel is going thru transitional period converting to a Marriott and the on site construction was not a issue for us at all. Booked the room thru Priceline and saved hundreds from hotel site.Hotel 480 is close to BART and right on Powell Cable car line. Check out Piraat Pizzeria down Sutter 600 block for amazing pizza,and Sears, 1/2 block down Powell has great food you can't go wrong.The best breakfast in San Fran ( They have many accolades) is at Mamas on Filbert 600 block on Washington Square..Get there early huge lines can develop for this one.We walked from Hotel 480 a couple of times to Mamas and built up a good morning appetite!! Try the walk to AT&T Park.. go up 3rd St to the Ballpark from Market, and then all the way back to Pier 39, down the Embarcadreo, it is splendid walking. Definitely would go back to Hotel 480 to enjoy another San Fran holiday.

Reviews.Title: “very good location bt rude staff”
Reviews.Author: gnikcin
Reviews.Content: reasonably priced, nice hotel, very good location. rude staff. i wud stay there again. cleaners took my sleeping bag by mistake and couldnt return it. very clean hotel, gym wasnt working and from the sounds of it, i wonder if it ever will open.

Reviews.Title: “Had a decent stay here”
Reviews.Author: travllng1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently. Room was comfortable. They gave us a high floor since the mezzanine level was torn apart and under construction. Good location downtown. Only problem we encountered was they have a computer by the front desk with a sign stating it is only to be used for printing airline boarding passes and to use the business center for internet use. (Business center is on mezzanine level which is torn apart) We asked at the front desk where we could find a computer for internet use, and the front desk agent rolled his eyes and said in a VERY snotty tone, " maybe you should have read the sign!" We told him that we did read it - we went and got the sign , brought it back to him and pointed out that the business center was torn apart. We got a " oh - sorry" Other than a front desk guy having a bad day, it was alright.

Reviews.Title: “We've got much more than we've payed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carolstapenhorst
Reviews.Content: My husband did the reservation 1 month in advance and we stayed 4 nigths for $99/rate. The room was adequate size, clean, good bathroom with an amazing tube, wonderfull king bed. High floor with a wiew. Starbucks just in fron of. Cablecar on the corner. The best location for a tourist: walking distance to stores and restaurants even in the night (we felt secure). Easy access to MUNI. The only problem: they make you phone call their providor (and wait a long time on the line) and pay $10/d to have internet and there staff are rude . A tip for first travelers to SF: Union Square is the best place to stay. Just: DON'T DARE HAVE A CAR THERE ($46/night).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would go back!”
Reviews.Author: ellives
Reviews.Content: Got a huge room on the 29th floor. Two big beds plus a settee. Plenty of space and a great location. Five minutes to downtown, 2 minutes to union square. Starbucks outside the entrance plus a range of restaurants very closeby. did the tourist thing and had breakfast at Sears 1 minute away. Got there at 8am on Sunday morning,no queues. Truly a lovely breakfast. In all, very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: MissyWAlbuquerque_NM
Reviews.Content: Would stay here again. Very good rate. Easy walk from Bart and 1 block from Union Square. Staff helpful, room clean, nice comfortable bed. Everything you might need (Walgreens), dining, close by.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: EyeBeen_thereB4
Reviews.Content: From the second that my family and I pulled up to the hotel until we left, we were treated as if we owned the place. The whole hotel is non-smoking...huge plus in my book. From the doorman to the desk staff, everyone was concerned that our stay was the best experience that it could be. The hotel was very well decorated (fair share of marble included), sparkling clean, smelled great...there is not anything about this hotel that was negative. I know that there may be more "plush" hotels...but I include the level of service from the staff when reviewing a hotel. I would compare this hotels service with any of the hotels I've stayed at in Hong Kong or Tokyo. I look forward to the oportunity to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: joenaustex
Reviews.Content: I get to San Fran every other month and this hotel ends up to be a great deal time after time. You can usually find a great deal on travelocity or orbitz. If you can, ask for a corner room. They are with two sides full of windows, huge king bed, two sitting areas, they also have a fridge. The hotel is in the heart of union square and has eating places across the street along with a walgreens.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: FLJulie
Reviews.Content: With so many hotels to choose from in San Francisco, I was hoping I had selected one that I could call Excellent and Hotel 480 fit the bill! The hotel and room exceeded my expectation and the location is perfect! Following check-in by a very helpful staff, we walked across the street from the hotel and hopped on a cable car - even my 15 year-old daughter thought that was pretty cool! Our room was large and very comfortable for the three of us (2 adults, 1 teenager). And after my husband dragged us around the city until 11:00pm we were happy that there was a Starbucks on an opposite corner! Would definitely recommed this hotel and it will be my first choice when we visit San Francisco again!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Hotel 480”
Reviews.Author: pegster110
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel 480 and have no compaints whatsoever. Its a very decent hotel in a great location. Its close to great shopping and the Bart as well as being convenient for most of the major tourist options. All in all a solid hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dadair6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel 480 on our honeymoon. Upon late arrival we were greeted at the curb by the bellhop who helped us with our bags from the cab. We were upgraded from a standard high-floor room to a corner suite looking out to the bay. The views were fantastic! The hotel staff was great and the Concierge was very helpful and friendly every time we needed help. They also arranged an airport shuttle for us. The location is perfect, especially if you don't have a rental car. The cable car line is right outside the door and streetcar and subway stops are only a couple blocks away. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. It was our first time in San Francisco and we'll definitely stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Stay Hotel 480”
Reviews.Author: Bdbc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 480 June 21-23. We arrived early so they held our bags till we could check in later in the day. The bellman and the front desk clerk were very friendly. They both offered great advice about how to get tickets for the transporation in the city. The bellman drew a map and wrote down the Hotel phone # in case we got lost. The hotel location is fantastic. One block from the square. Starbucks, and Walgreens across the street.Our room was large with two double beds, large picture window overlooking the city. Nice fluffy towels with Bath & body works samples. Our beds were comfortable.The hotel needs to upgrade the pillows to feather pillows not foam. A mini fridge would be nice too.My girls enjoyed playing the cd player in the room. Nice size tv with remote. We would definitly stay at Hotel 480 in the future.Valet parking is quite expensive. That's the city. I did find one block over the Sutter/Stockton Parking lot for 33.50 a day.Still high but more reasonable then the hotel and most of the lots in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel 480”
Reviews.Author: cookinma
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a terrific location near Union Square with restaurants and trolley line. Very clean, with a huge corner room. Nice staff, very helpful concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms and service - a bit noisy though”
Reviews.Author: IanDuncan
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 18th floor of this hotel for seven nights. (Me, my wife and three kids aged 7, 9 and 9 yrs) The rooms were clean, and the service we received was as expected from a four star hotel... Toiletries and towels replaced every day, room immaculate on our return, etc. (One or two days the room was only serviced after lunch, inconveniencing us a little. However, a call to housekeeping corrected that for the balance of our stay.) Staying in the middle of a big city, noise is expected. We were surprised however at the city policy to collect refuse between 1am and 5am. Closed windows helped somewhat, but if you are not used to this it can be disturbing. The hotel is extremely well situated in the city. It it literally two blocks from the gates to Chinatown, and three blocks from the main city block. We did not need a car at all for the time we stayed there. (We had, however, just complete a two week stint in Orlando seeing the parks, so my family were walking fit ). We had a wonderful walk from the hotel to Pier 39, and returned along one of the tram lines. The hotel was also quite accommodating to provide additional blankets, and a very early checkout. A further value of the hotel is that it is situated across the road from a Walgreens where we bought milk and cereal to save on breakfast costs. On the opposite corner is Starbucks who made a reasonable Venti Cuppucino ! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “snobby hotel with a view”
Reviews.Author: merimasdk
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the amenities you'd expect, the sort of room you'd expect, etc etc, and a spectacular view (I stayed at the 25th floor looking directly out over Union Square and SoMa). The staff was less than helpful though, a very cool reception at check-in, not superbly attentive staff in the restaurant, and porters who only offered help with a heavy suitcase after I already had reached the doors. Definitely a cold and somewhat snobby impression of the staff - even although they did everything you'd need from hotel staff. I later stayed in the much cheaper Powell Hotel and got a ten times better treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: neonp
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this property in 1995 when it was a Holiday Inn, and loved the fact that it was right on the cable car line. During our most recent trip, we wanted to spend the night in San Francisco, and I was able to contact the hotel directly during our drive to book a room. While I had requested a King room with a rollaway for the three of us, upon arrival the desk clerk suggested that the room would be crowded that way, and suggested a room with two doubles--this was fine, except that I am married to a big guy and am used to a queen bed. Nonetheless,, the room was very comfortable, and quiet. The decor was quite nice as well, and the room was very clean. I did know that I would need to have the car valet parked, but when we arrived, because of the luggage carrier on the roof, they informed me that they would have to charge me the oversize vehicle parking fee! Also, one of the front desk clerks (not the one who checked us in), insisted that the bellman take our bags to the room, making me feel obligated to tip him. It must have been a hotel image thing, because I did not necessarily need or want a bellman's assistance! Also, expect to pay to use anykind of computer/internet service! I think $25 a day is a bit absurd, let alone the 2.99 an hour if using at the business center. While the room charge was VERY reasonable for San Francisco, beware of the "extras" that will get tacked on to the bill! Otherwise, it is a fantastic place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: 99TravelBug99
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Hotel 480 over Memorial Day Weekend. The hotel was in a great location, right near Union Square and all the shopping and about 3-4 blocks from China Town. Got a great deal for $119/night which I thought was good for a holiday weekend in San Fran. Staff was friendly, bartender recommended some restaurants and a fun piano bar a few blocks down. Rooms were cleaned promtply every day. Shower was good. My complaints are that the bed was pretty hard. Not terrible but enough to feel it in your back when you woke up. Also, the walls are very thin, we could hear our neighbors. But aside from that, the location and price were right.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Rioss
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel 480 for 6 nights for a holiday. For the price paid (approx USD90), it was a great deal. The hotel is located just 2 blocks from Union Square where all the shopping and food are, just opposite a pharmacy / convenience store, borders bookstore, and right outside the cable car tram stop! Major bus lines, tram lines, BART station are just short walks away. Safe enough for a single traveller, as the roads are always crowded with people. The room decor is very old-fashioned, but it comes with everything you need (except a minibar), and is very clean and comfortable. The room, bed, bathroom is nice and big. Despite the age of the furnishings, it didnt smell too dated! Frontdesk , bell, housekeeping staff are fast, helpful and knowledgable. No wireless internet in the room, but wired internet available for USD10 for 24 hrs. Had a lot of problems getting connected, but the internet company had a good toll-free helpline. For this price, i would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - An Economical Gem”
Reviews.Author: racheljs74
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler and stayed at the hotel for a personal reason, so I wasn't sure what I'd get for the money. This was an unexpectedly wonderful hotel. I used priceline to get 2 nights at $300 with tax included -- a steal in San Francisco's Union Square. It was a great stay, and the best part was the staff. They were nice, helpful, and caring. When we forgot our shampoo, they immediately shipped it to us. I really was surprised at what I got for the money. I'd stay again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - get it while it lasts”
Reviews.Author: dentarthurdent
Reviews.Content: 3 nights in downtown SF (one block from Union Sq) for only $99 per night. At these prices, who cares about tired decor? Rumour has it (overheard in the lift) that this former Crowne Plaza is only on gardening leave before becoming a Marriott - prices will surely rise. At the moment, you get a large, clean room in a great location - which is all we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: firecopcouple
Reviews.Content: When checking in, the staff was friendly but I couldn't seem to "encourage" any upgrades or niceties. It was mentioned we were pre-paid through Expedia as an excuse to just check us in without fanfare. Everything was good but a little stoic, when we disturbed the maid still cleaning the assigned room. A call to the front desk immediately got us an upgraded room (family suite) with plenty of apologies. I suspect my first desk clerk was just a little tired or distracted and wasn't in the mood for my cajoling. No regrets, the room was wonderfully large enough to accommodate my teenage daughterâ€™s explosion of clothes and travel supplies. The hotel is on the cable line with a stop on the corner. Rides to Market Street were almost unnecessary because five blocks downhill was nothing. Coming home or going to the piers was easy with the cable line. My only regret is my room looked directly at The Cheesecake Factory two blocks away on top of Macys. I think I resisted one night out of four, going to sleep without a slice of "sin" ruining my diet. For those needing a workout facility, the hotel's is being remodeled. They give you a "comp" card for 24 hr fitness five blocks away. It wasn't offered at first but seemed to be no problem once I asked. Do eat at "Sears fine foods" across the street and down the block (visible from the front door). Their mini Swedish pancakes are fantastic. French toast was pretty good as well. Overall, I think I enjoyed the best medium budget version of a downtown hotel. You can spend less and get a lot less. I not sure you can get much more without really turning out your wallet. For trips three days and over, buy the Muni pass. Cable cars are $5 a ride no matter how short and the Muni subway and busses are easy to figure out. You can see every sight without a car. This is truly a mass transit city, so take advantage

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a fantastic price!”
Reviews.Author: GandT-n-WV
Reviews.Content: Very good location, just a few blocks from the Mall and lots of nice places to eat there, street car just 60 feet from front entrance. The view, we were on the 28th floor and had a wonderful view. I Would like to stay there again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “A Work in Progress--Literally!”
Reviews.Author: christianneanastasia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel 480 for four nights after booking it through Priceline at a very reasonable rate. The location can't be beaten--it's about a block north of Union Square and just a few blocks from Chinatown (North Beach is also walkable if you can handle the steep hills in between). While I can't complain about the room--it was nicely appointed and clean--there were two major points of contention between the hotel's website and my experience. First, the hotel's fitness center is NOT OPEN. It's being renovated for the foreseeable future, which I hadn't known in advance (it would have been nice to be apprised of this!). The front desk said that they had made alternative arrangements with the 24 Hour Fitness located five blocks away, but that 480 guests would have to pay $5 per day to use the facility. I was horrified that they expected guests to pay for something which was supposed to be included--especially in light of the fact that it's WAY more inconvenient to use some strange gym than to just run downstairs to the hotel's own fitness center. When I expressed this, the manager offered to give me 2 days for $5, which I accepted (and by the way, the gym itself was pretty nice, but if you're a runner or a walker, you're SO much better off exercising outside because you get as much of a workout --no kidding, this city has some SERIOUS hills--and simultaneously get to enjoy exploring the city). I was still irked, though, that they charged me anything at all for something that I was promised when I booked (though I see that they've changed the website recently to reflect the situation). Secondly, there is no wireless access in the guestrooms at all. If you want to access the Internet, you have to pay $10/day for a high-speed connection, or you can go sit in the lobby and pay $5 for three hours of wireless. Can you get more stingy? Considering San Francisco's supposed to be one of the most "wired" cities in the country, the fact that the hotel doesn't even provide wireless coverage in its guestrooms is disappointing. A better option than the $10 high-speed connection is to connect to the wireless network of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel (located across the street) which is only $7 per day and sent a pretty strong signal over to my guestroom (and probably all guestrooms on the south side of the building). Overall, the staff were fantastic, but these flaws left me feeling somewhat disappointed. Had I known these issues before booking, I would have adjusted my expectations (and knowing them now, I'd still probably stay there again if only for the unbeatable location), If you don't require in-room wireless or the use of gym facilities, I'd highly recommend the 480, but if you do, you might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price”
Reviews.Author: Jmbradle
Reviews.Content: We got a great cheap price -- $160/nite. Excellent for the location in the shopping district of Union Square. The room was clean and partially updated with white linens and duvet. Walls seem thin, but no trouble with loud noise. Good workout room. Very helpful bellman, Perry, who got me bag back when I left it in the airport shuttle bus! Great value for the price

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - RUDE RUDE RUDE desk staff”
Reviews.Author: weeangel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip in December 07 (single female travelling alone from the UK) and chose this hotel 1. to get Priority Club points 2. for the location. The location is superb - absolutely excellent, really can't fault it for being so central to the main shopping - I even went back a couple of times on my non-work day to drop off bags. No problems at all re safety, going out to eat in the evenings on my own etc etc. However - the front desk staff are appalling. When I went to empty my safety deposit box prior to check out (10 mins to go) I waited in line until it was my turn, went to the desk to be told, very rudely, that I had to wait while a bunch of airline staff were checked out. No apologies - no 'would you mind if we dealt with these people first' just literally 'WAIT'!! So rude!!!! I stated that I had a plane to catch as well to be told that didn't matter! Regardless of the great location you couldn't pay me to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We love Hotel 480! Highly Recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: Steri-Clean
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend in San Francisco (Union Square). I can't say enough about it. Other reviews before ours complained about renovations, but they must be completed now because we saw no signs of this. The rooms were clean and the staff always went out of there way to make us feel as if we were their only guests. The view from our room overlooking Union Square and the entire City was unbelievable. We sat at the bar late one night and received excellent service from Thomas a long time bartender there. The hotel is on the cable car line which gives you easy access to anywhere you want to go outside of Union Square. Everything else from restaraunts, night clubs, and all the shops are within easy walking distance. The conciere was so helpful with everything from trip planning to printing out our boarding passes for our return trip home. If you are looking for a room in the Union Square area, I highly recommend Hotel 480....soon to become a Marriot though.

Reviews.Title: “a RUDE awakening....”
Reviews.Author: digitalcrabs
Reviews.Content: my experience was awful. i was there for a conference, in the big ballroom. of course- very very weak wireless internet access and when you told the front desk--- they looked at you like you have 3 eyes. ditto on the weak net access from the rooms. what a joke-- why cant they get this right! first my key didnt work (same experience a guy next to me at checkin had). the rude front desk lady (who will go unnamed) kept insulting our intelligence saying we were putting in the card wrong. duh... next one of the bellmen took our tip, then handed the bags back to us-- true story... say he didnt have time to take the bags to our room. two positives were the very nice concierge lady (extremely helpful and patient) and the cleaning ladies (promote them please to the front desk). wow! the front desk needs alot of work. teach them the internet and that guests get frustrated when everywhere they turn, nothing works. and hey be nice. several of us were trying to print boarding passes at the front desk. they couldnt do it. and wouldnt let us look behind the counter to help. more rudeness. then we were instructed to go upstairs to the business center (read that money grab) where the fees were a joke, and (you guessed it) very SLOW internet access and a printer out of toner. think they had more? right, now way-- had to be ordered. all in all a bad experience, starting with the poorly managed front desk. this hotel needs a brand, the staff needs retraining, and the GM (who was nowhere to be found when all these problems were occurring) should spend some time with the guests. cant say enough about how the experience started negatively with a rude front desk person and zero help from all the bell staff standing around. oh- and did i mention that my tv volume control didnt work... i called the front desk, then the gm's office, and am still waiting for a call back (i checked out 3 days ago!). stay at the westin next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoTB
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a nice hotel, especially for the price (about $90 per night via priceline on Valentine's/ President Day weekend). The location is GREAT - right in the heart of the union square area. The staff was very kind & attentive, they upgraded us to a jr. suite upon arrival, since they were sold out of regular rooms with king sized beds. The room was large, comfortable & very clean (the carpeting was a bit old, but I believe they are renovating). I would stay there again & for me (a very picky hotel guest, who won't step foot into a hotel unless it's rated at bare minimum 3 stars) that's saying a lot. It's not a 4 or 5 star luxury hotel by any means, but I would recommend it for a nice weekend getaway when you want to be right in the heart of things - especially if you get a good room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 480 is still a great place”
Reviews.Author: APAlSoCal
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel 480 for at least 4 nights each of the past 7 years. It was the Crowne Plaza for the first 6 and recently became the Hotel 480 before my most recent stay. The service remains top notch and the rooms are comfortable. Not much has changed since the name switch. The only difference I noted was the absence of the Crowne Plaza "sleep kit", which isn't that much of a loss. The mattresses and bedding are pleasant and there is plenty of work space if you are on business. If you are travelling with family, I suggest you request one of their "Family Rooms". These rooms are at the end of each floor. I've stayed on both ends-if you like the sound of cable cars, the rooms located on the Powell and Sutter corner will do just fine. If you want more quiet, try to get the opposite end of the hall. The location is fantastic with many shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. As noted earlier, two cable car routes run right past the hotel and their are numerous taxis on the street. The BART station is down Powell Street, about a easy 10 minute walk. The hotel is going to go through a year-long remodeling project. Five floors at a time will be refurbished, so be sure to ask about the work in progress before you book. I spend quite a few nights of the year in hotels on business and I always enjoy my stay at this property. One addition I hope they do make is to put a spark in their on site bar and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, large rooms, good, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fluffychuffy
Reviews.Content: The locaiton of this hotel is great - right near all the shopping and minutes from China Town and other restaurants. Really enjoyed my stay here - very nice big room, perfectly clean and spacious. This is not a luxury hotel but is certainly good quality and has everything you need. Is being turned in to a Marriott I think so will be up to that standard soon I imagine. I have no complaints - price was good, hotel in exellent location, nice and clean, friendly people, great big room, lots of channels on the TV - what more could you want? There is a good restaurant called the Daily Grill which serves nice brekkies, lunch and dinner - it is like an upmarket diner - as you come out of the hotel, walk straight down the hill towards Union Square - keep walking and you will pass Union Square on the left hand side and Victoria's secret on the right then take the next right and you will see the restaurant on the left hand side.

Reviews.Title: “New Name, New Ownership, New Issues...”
Reviews.Author: dreampilot
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza was sold and this hotel is now known as the "Hotel 480". Having stayed here before the change and now for 5 days after the change, I have a comparison that is not very favorable for the new ownership. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION Before I go any further let's state the obvious. You cannot beat the location of this hotel, regardless of who owns it or what name is painted on the outside. Located one block north of Union Square, right on the cable car line and with ample public (read - much cheaper than the hotel parking) within a block - visitors to the city will appreciate the central location. We parked the car on arrival and had absolutely no need to use it for the whole week until departure. Now the not so good news.,, Hopefully it's just the pains of transition causing some service issues but I have to say the majority of negatives with our stay were associated with the service. We had troubles with housekeeping opening a door clearly identified as "Do Not Disturb", phone calls from engineering at 6am about problems we never reported, etc. We were here with MacWorld and selected the hotel because it claimed free internet access for conference attendees - this was not so. This may be a problem with the MacWorld folks though. But once connected for the internet "broadband" - you're better off taking your chances on a modem. The internet access is terrible and in tremendous need of upgrade. The onsite restaurant is outrageously overpriced even for Union Square. We recommend Lori's across the street for a more reasonable (although not gourmet but still good) breakfast or lunch. We're hoping the sad state of the hallways on the 9th floor were due to intended/scheduled remodeling because if not - the condition of that floor is not anything a $199 a night hotel should be proud of regardless of it's location. Minor issues like a TV that continually shut itself off and on again can be overlooked if it wasn't for the $199 a night price. Speaking of the TVs - the small TV provided is kind of strange considering most major hotels upgrades to flat screens and larger models. Having said all that - We hope that this hotel gets it together and may try it again for a one or two night stay in the future to see if things improve. It would be such a waste to have a hotel with such a great location and enthusiastic staff to be hampered by a lack of infrastructure maintenance and management. So we'd be interested to see future reviews from Trip Advisor folks as to the state of this hotel in transition.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: bright2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline. I was a little wary at first since I could not find reviews for this hotel, but I later realized that what they now call Hotel 480 was actually the former Crowne Plaza Union Square. First off, the hotel is very clean and the staff are very pleasant. Even when I called beforehand to confirm my reservation, the front desk was very helpful and very willing to note my room preferences. Usually, when I book with other hotels using Priceline, I get a lot of "what we have left is what you get" type of responses, but not this hotel. Their pleasant, efficient service continued when I checked in in person. I had a guest with me and they even automatically asked her what her name was, just in case we lost keys and she needed to get in. Room - they honored our request and put us on the 20th floor with a nice view. The windows span the wall and give you a very expansive, airy feel. The room is cozy, but very clean and tastefully decorated. We got a king bed that was rather comfortable - wasn't the best of the beds I've slept in, but not bad. There were a couple of annoyances, however. First, valet parking at $43 + 14% tax (almost 50!) is just absurd. The second night, I found local garage parking for about $26 overnight. Secondly, internet service in the room is restricted to wired only. Normally that would be fine, but my gf and I both had to do work and were using separate computers. Without wireless, we couldn't do that at the same time. All in all, this hotel is great, beats many 4 stars that I've stayed in before, and is well worth it (especially given the low fare we found using priceline). I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Union Square Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasMike
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza, Union Square, San Francisco. We were extremely pleased with our recent two night stay. Room was nicely appointed, well maintained, and clean. Directly on the Powell Street Cable Car line - and a rather steep two block walk to the California Street Cable line. Walk to everything in Union Square- as well as to the Moscone. You're just blocks fron the Chinatown Gate on Grant St. Pricey breakfast buffet was well worth the expense- it was over the top and the best of everything: fruit, pastries, yogurt, artisan cheeses, cakes, breads- not to mention the cooked to order items. Service is nothing short of exceptional. Each evening we walked to the nearby pubs and enjoyed a drink or two. You will still need to be mindful of the "street people" in this neighborhood, especially at night, but overall- you won't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - great location”
Reviews.Author: DavidAndPed
Reviews.Content: Really happy with our stay, wanted to stay another night! What a great location, step out of the hotel an a block away you are at union square. Will definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: barbara888
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night but the staff was very nice and the room was nice and clean. Bed was comfortable and the front desk was helpful with directions. Close to everything downtown. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “SO private yet a stones throw from Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Carlii1964
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, but the rooms were great and seo close to Union Square! We had a ball and had 2 rooms from Hotwire for only $55 a night all taxes. I would stay here again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: smiffy79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 5 nights in September as part of our 2 week holiday in America. The hotel was in a great location near Union Square and we were able to walk to most places which we really enjoyed. We got the BART from the airport to the hotel â€“ it was shortish walk from the station but we found the hotel very easily. We had booked the hotel through priority points and I think may have got an upgrade because of this. Our room was very large and had a beautiful view over Nob hill with the cable cars running up and down. The bed was huge and very comfortable. There was some noise at night and you could hear the cable cars going up and down sometimes but I think that is what you expect in a big city! We had a wonderful time in San Francisco â€“ we ended up walking nearly everywhere as the queues for the cable cars were ridiculous. There are so many nice restaurants to choose from, you are spoilt for choice. We ate at Loriâ€™s diner on our first night which is just next to the hotel and is great for burgers and shakes! We had breakfast at Sears fine foods one morning when we were up early and it was really good, thankfully there was no queue as there was one every other morning. Other than that we ventured further out to Chinatown, North Beach etc and found some great places. I would definitely recommend the Crowne Plaza to anyone, it is in a great location in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty good...”
Reviews.Author: yvieinca
Reviews.Content: The Crowne was booked for us by my husbands work. It was one of the few hotels still available for the VMWorld conference, so we took it at a rate of $210 a night. When we arrived, we found the parking garage and pulled in. We were quickly told that we couldnâ€™t get any help with our bags if we stayed in the parking garage, but the nice man there offered to bring the car around front for us so that we could go check in then get our bags. This was greatly appreciated after our nerve wracking trip from the South Bay to the city. (We stayed the previous two nights in the south bay to visit some friends). My husband and I gathered up our few items we wanted to keep with us at all times, and walked down the very steep (and slippery, BE CAREFUL!) garage area to the stairs outside to enter the hotel. When we arrived inside the lobby we saw the lobby packed with airline employees waiting to check out. There were probably 50-75 people ahead of us in line. My husband sat down on a bench with our items and I waited outside for our car. Our car arrived about 15 minutes later just as all the airline employees were boarding a bus to apparently go to work. As I helped the bellman unload the car, my husband called to let me know we were checked in and ready to go. The Crowne had upgraded us to a junior suite on the 23rd floor. The view from the room was absolutely spectacular, we slept with the curtains open every night so we could see the beautiful city lights. The room was quite nice and spacious. The bathroom was against the back wall, next to that was a small table and chairs for eating or playing cards. There was a rather large living room area with a sofa, coffee table, a chair and a television in a cabinet with some drawers and a refrigerator. Beyond that was a half wall separating the living area from the sleeping area. Directly in front of the bed was a desk with a light and outlets ready for your laptop. The room was very clean, the bed was extremely comfortable with plenty of blankets and pillows. Internet was not included in the price of the room. It was $10 a day for internet access, or $35 for the week. I understand that this is typical in upscale hotels, even though it frustrates me. That being said, when I pay for internet access in a hotel, I expect enough bandwidth to be able to conduct business (VPN access). The download speeds were frequently less than 200kbps, which is totally unacceptable. This was one of the recommended hotels for the VMWorld conference, which is a computer-related convention. A hotel should expect high internet usage when they are a participant hotel for a high-tech conference, and be prepared to handle it. Even on Thursday night, when most of the conference participants had left, the bandwidth still didnâ€™t exceed 310kbps. My expectations for $10/day internet access are much higher than free WiFi in non-premium hotels, and unfortunately the Crowne Plaza didnâ€™t come close to meeting those expectations. We opted not to use the room service available, since the cheapest thing on the menu was a $22 hamburger that didnâ€™t seem all that special from the description on the menu. A morning pot of coffee was $7, and a basic breakfast was over $15. Instead we went to the grocery store and bought a few staple items and frequented restaurants in the area. Most of the staff members we ran in to were very polite and friendly, especially the housekeeping staff. Parking was somewhat of a fiasco. It took a minimum of 15 minutes every time we needed our car, sometimes closer to a half an hour. At one point one of the door men got rather testy with me and told me I should call for the car before going downstairs, otherwise we should just go to the garage ourselves to get the car. (Which was fine with me, less tipping!) Not only did they expect a tip every time we got in or out of the car, the parking was $60 a day. (Yes, I said $60 A DAY). I understand real estate is at a premium in SF, but $60 a day?!?!? Again, no choice we had to pay it. When we went to check out my husband mentioned the problems with the internet, and how important it was for him to have internet access, he was met with a snide â€œSorryâ€�, and handed a receipt. Overall the room was lovely and most of the staff were polite and helpful. Would I stay here again? Maybe. It surely wouldnâ€™t be my first choice by any stretch. Itâ€™s very important for computer people to have reliable internet access. If it were free, we wouldnâ€™t complain, but considering less expensive hotels have better internet access this was a big disappointment. The room service menu being SO highly priced also put us off a little. The parking, well honestly it was kind of disastrous for us. So only in a pinch would we stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: guyinAZ
Reviews.Content: First things first: The location of the hotel is just about perfect: cable car outside, with Chinatown, Union Square shopping and restaurants all very close by. I didn't eat at the hotel--a full breakfast was about $23. A nice breakfast can be had across the street at Sears--a San Francisco institution--for about $10 less. The room I had was a standard king and was fairly small, had a coffeemaker but no refrigerator and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was unremarkable but sufficient. The hotel staff were very nice; the doormen especially so. A huge number of airline crews stay here. The lobby is relatively small--considering it's a 30 story hotel-- with limited seating if you're the type who likes to lounge around and watch the world go by. I spent an entire week at this hotel and also the Grand Hyatt(on a previous stay), which is a block away. If it's a matter of a night or two, it probably doesn't make much difference, but for an extended stay, I'd choose the Grand Hyatt--much better views, nicer room decor and a more upscale ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Suberb Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Yarnold
Reviews.Content: 3 of us shared a quad room for 5 nights whilst sightseeing. After arriving gone midnight and missing our luggage due to flight delays, the only Porter on duty was able to run around and get us all the toiletries and Robes we needed to relieve the effects of travelling for 36 hours. Our room was very spacious over looking Sutter Street itself, I suspect it may have been a disabled room because of the wetroom and rails, instead of a bath. No issue with cleanliness and beds very comfy indeed. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: NovAbroad
Reviews.Content: We booked a family holiday on the West Coast of US and stayed at Crowne Plaza Garden Grove, Caesars Las Vegas, Crowne Plaza Union Square San Francisco and Crowne Plaza Redondo Beach LA. I am a Priority Club member that is why my preference for Crowne Plaza. There were 7 of us in two rooms at each hotel. The Crowne Plaza Union Square is in a great location with the cable car stop just outside (Powell Street) and is close to great shops. The run to the bay isn't too bad. The hotel is a little old and could do with a refurb. We booked 4 months in advance and asked for adjoining rooms but ended up on seperate floors. OK but wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not that impressed”
Reviews.Author: Richk582
Reviews.Content: On a bussiness trip, stayed here one night. Really just not that impressed with this hotel. Close to the Cable Car line, but other than that, not really in the best of locations. Lobby was dark, not very colorful or welcoming. Staff was friendly but i was practically forced to use a bellhop for my one bag. I think i can find my own way to the room, thanks. Elevators were quick and always available, but needed to be updated. Many of the buttons wouldnâ€™t light, or the floor numbers were not legible. Room was, again, ok but not great. Furnishings were old, dark, not updated. View wasnâ€™t that great. Bathroom also needed an update as everything just seemed old. Bed was ok, not very comfy, alarm clock was some kind of crazy thing that played different nature sounds or chiming bells for an alarm. Really, i just need a simple to use alarm clock I'm not really a big fan of the Holiday-Inn owned properties, and for the price of this hotel would rather stay at a Hyatt, or Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Local take...”
Reviews.Author: cwcharacters
Reviews.Content: Every once and awhile, we take a "getaway" from our East Bay home to the greatest city in the country, San Francisco. We try different hotels and restaurants and shop til we drop. This last trip was truly a pleasant surprise, as we found a jewel of a hotel in the Crowne Plaza Union Square. This hotel was priced right and gave us everything we were looking for. So much so that we stayed an extra night! The hotel check-in staff was courteous, helpful and friendly, as were the breakfast restaurant staff. We had an Executive "club" room with access to the lounge. (The "club/lounge" is actually just a big suite with a TV and no services. Nice to hang out in if you're an early riser and don't want to disturb your roommate). Breakfast was included and was great. We were near the top of the hotel with a great view of the bay. We appreciated the "quiet zone" with no kids allowed in that section. Nice and quiet! The room was clean and well appointed. The bathroom was small, but had some nice amenities. I must say that I do like the new focus on sleeping soundly. The scented spray and sleep-sounds CD were a nice touch. The hotel is centrally located and close to everything. While we may continue to experience other SF hotels, we will definetly return to the Crowne Plaza Union Square in the not so distant future and will recommend it to out-of-town friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely breakfest.....”
Reviews.Author: kuiken
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple nights in the Crown Plaza, and it was a pleasant stay. The staff behind reception, most important people when your arrive, first impression, were helpfull. Information is good, and welwilling. The staff offered the 11% discount card for the Macy's store themselves, I did not had to ask for it. And when I forgot my keycard, no problem a new one was made without any questions. Compliment. The room was good. 17th floor. Specially the dream-and sleep comfortbag. They know that people from Europe have there jet-lag problems.There is a CD-player in the room, with excersises to relax with nice music. An eyecover, a pillow-perfume and so on. that's what people call: custumor service. The breakfest: Nice and charming atmosphere. Plenty of choices from the buffet and the menu. Helpfull staff, and for most of all very friendly. That's something people want and need in the morning after a 11 hour flight. Location is als great, nearby the Union Square with al the shops and the cablecar in the front. My stay: just short, was a pleasant stay in San Francisco. The Crown Plaze took care of it. And myself of course. Yes: a hotel to recommand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hbyerly
Reviews.Content: Good-sized room w new bedding (7 layers of comfort). Clean, well-appointed bathroom, but quite small. Amenity kit with linen spray in room. Great downtown location, $9 cab ride to Pier 39. Restaurant is v expensive - $22 for eggs and bacon. Front desk is outstanding, concierge very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Crowne Plaza Union Square”
Reviews.Author: sullymom
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at this Crowne Plaza. The staff is to great, they cannot do enough to make your trip great! From the Concierge to housekeeping and everyone in between they were great. Our room was CLEANED every day, and I mean clean! We were upgraded to a "family room" which was 2 doubles and a queen sleeper for just a few dollars more well worth it!! The location is the best. You are a half a block from Union Sq. and a few feet from the cable car stop. No need for a car in the city! I would stay here again if I'm every able to get to the oppostie coast again:)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dani_Serres
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is the best cost/benefit relation in San Francisco! It is located at Union Square, a great place to be, where you can walk until late at night. I had booked a standard room but was offered an upgrade for only $35 more and got internet access, complimentary drinks every night and free america breakfast (which is wonderful). Highly reccomend it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big room, simple amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Davidwithoutborders
Reviews.Content: Great location, just north of Union Square. The staff let us check-in early. Very big room, clean and great water pressure in bathroom. Drawbacks - basic amenities, and beds were not particularly comfy. Also, hotel beginning to show its age. Overall, though, very happy with stay and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “liked location”
Reviews.Author: Tixilix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 3 nights on our honeymoon. We paid for an executive room but got a suite which was very large and quiet. The decor was perhaps a little tired and the bath small. The Wi Fi is not free here which was an issue for us.Breakfast is not included but is not expensive, the public areas of the hotel could do with updating. Service was fine. The best thing about the hotel is the location by Union square handy for everywhere. We tried to get in the Mark Hopkins initially and went to the wonderful bar whilst in san francisco, The mark hopkins appeared to be of a higher standard but is up a very steep hill.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: gasLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend there. Did not need a car, or anything else for a great time. Easy walk from the train station to the hotel. Right in the center of everything in Union Square and the theater district, all an easy walk. Trolly car stop right outside th door. Wallgreens type drug store across the street. Endless restaurants, shopping, theatres all around. Quick trolly ride down to Fisherman,s Warf. Bicycle ride over the Golden Gate Bridge. All without ever using a taxi or car. Hotel had very clean, spacious well appointed rooms in new looking condition. My room had a nice city and bay view. Reasonable rate. Very quick check in. Absolutely nothing to complain about on my trip or with this hotel. 2 blocks from Union Square park where I spent hours just sitting, sipping beer, reading and people watching in the center of an art exhibit. Great! 75 degree sunny weather helped alot. All I needed was a female companion to make it perfect. Lots of attractive people there. With more time I could have fallen in love. The photos below are from my bicycle trip around the bay. 8 miles biking with a ferry ride back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: thecustomer
Reviews.Content: Location just off Union Square is great. & I have no idea how this hotel gets 4 ****... there's nothing else special about it, at all. Perfectly, polite staff at a quick check in (they could teach others how to do that!). Room clean, but not freshly decorated - ie the shower rail is the third one top be fitted - you can see the filled-in fixings in the tiles. There isn't wifi in the rooms, only in the lobby, and it's not free, as claimed. Wired internet in the rooms is charged too. I'd stay again, but only if there wasn't somewhere else nearby to try out.

Reviews.Title: “Location A+++, very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Chiefy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crown Plaza Union Square for a conference for five days at the end of February, 2007. The hotel was predetermined, but I was still apprehensive after reading some of the reviews here. On arrival from the east coast on an early flight, I was greeted at the front desk by Jeff. He was pleasant and efficient, and had me on my way to my room in minutes. My room was on the 16th floor, and although I would have preferred higher, it was all that was available. On the floor, in addition to rooms along the main corridor, there were five or six alcoves, with additional rooms off of them. To get to my room, I had to take a right, right and another right off of the elevator. This layout really cut down on the corridor traffic noise, but the room backed up to the noisy elevator shaft. The room itself was a king room, small, and dominated by the bed. There was also a chair and ottoman, large bureau, desk, and closet. The bathroom was small but efficiently laid out>>but if my wife were with me, there would have been a turf war over the bathroom size. The large window looked out over Powell St, and had a side window that opened, letting in fresh air. Street noise was heard, even with the window closed, but not as intrusive as the always present elevator noise. The room itself was immaculate...under the bed, behind the endtable, everywhere. Possibly the cleanest hotel room I have ever been in. Back to the bathroom for a minute. Nice toiletries, plenty of clean, fluffy towels, and great water pressure. Tub/shower was very narrow, and water got all over the floor after each shower. Maybe the addition of a curved shower curtain rod would diminish the cramped feel. The beds are really trumpeted, both on the website and in ads around the hotel. While comfortable, I didn't find it warranted the bragging. The lobby was functional and clean, and several in our group used the concierge, finding her helpful. As far as location, it was convenient to everywhere. Union Square was one block awayand Fishermans Wharf/Pier 39, etc is just a ride away on the famous cablecars that go right by out front of the hotel. I did not use room service, or the restaurants at the hotel, but did note that the food provided by the hotel as part of the conference was very good. I decided to attack the debate about breakfast restaurants I read about in the SF forum. I went to Lori's Diner across the street on the first morning. The food was excellent, and plentiful, and the waitstaff was extremely friendly and helpful. As I walked around the area after breakfast, I noticed about 20-25 people standing on line in front of Sears Fine Foods one block away. The next two mornings, I went to Sears for breakfast, didn't have to wait, and the food and service were exceptional. Prices were comparable. My vote in the debate would be for Sears, but you can't go wrong with either. Bottom line, the hotel was everything it presented itself to be on the website and in hotel literature. I have no regrets staying there, and would stay here again if ever back in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: zigy
Reviews.Content: First time we have been to San Francisco and found the whole week very enjoyable. This hotel is in a great location for both shopping and local transport. The hotel services we found were good with good rooms size and comfortable beds. We did not eat in the hotel as there are plenty of places out and about. We went to Sears across the road for breakfast most mornings (opposite the Francis Drake hotel,) exceptional breakfast and good value. We did the city tour and napa valley from the hotel. The concierge arranged it for us through Pacific Tours. The tour company use smaller 12 seater minibuses which is great for getting to know your fellow tourists, Geordie is a good guide and driver. We would definetely consider this hotel if we went back

Reviews.Title: “Good location, so so hotel”
Reviews.Author: swelch
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaze is just a block off of Union Square, so the location is very central, but that's probably the best thing is has going for it. I stayed in a King room on an executive floor, but couldn't really tell you what was "executive" about it. The decor was very average and not what I would have expected for $250 a night. My rate included a continental breakfast, which was served in their cafe downstairs. The food was pretty uninspired, but there was a wide selection of options. Good for free - If I had to pay the $19 fee for this meal I would have been very disappointed. Interesting features worth noting: -there was no mini bar in the room, but there was a small fridge which was empty. If you're there for an extended stay and want to buy a few things for yourself instead of paying sky high rates for snacks and drinks, this could be helpful. -if you have a computer with you and need to print a document, they had a nice service I haven't seen before where you could upload a document to their website and then have it printed and delivered to your room or pick it up at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping was shocking”
Reviews.Author: MillieLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok overall but my mine gripe was with housekeeping. I was in the room when it was being cleaned and looked up to see the maid rushing out with a large Macy's bag. i explained that the bag wasn't rubbish and there were expensive goods in there. She rudely told me that there wasn't and she couldn't get the bag back because it had now been 'taken'. She then said that she would try and retrieve it and it would be returned to my room later that day. When I came back to the room in the evening, there was no sign of the bag and I then called the front desk who investigated the incident. I did receive some compensation and was advised that they were taking the matter seriously. When the maid was questioned she denied even touching the bag and said I was lying. In short, I will not be returning to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Unpretentious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobSu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights and the experience was delightful. Staff couldn't be more helpful. Our room was very spacious with great views down Powell and west to Ocean Beach. This was our 3rd stay in SF and this was without doubt the best hotel and not the most expensive we've stayed in. 1 block from Union square with the cable car going past the hotel, this is ideal for shopping and access to the excellent public transport system. We would recommend this hotel for business or vacation, it is unpretentious and the effort is therefore put into making the guests stay hassel free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelling33
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel stay. I was in town for less than fun reasons (my father was having surgery) so having a nice retreat was wonderful. The room was large and very clean. The bed and bedding were cozy. Had dinner at the end of the day at the restaurant on site and had a delicious dinner. The location is good, close to Union Square and theaters. The staff was very nice. Free internet would be a welcomed improvement, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: bhoffa24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from spending 4 nights at the Crowne Plaza. Good: Staff- The staff was one of the highlights of this hotel. Every employee said hello or asked how we were doing whether it was the doorman or one of the maids. Location- right where you want to be. one block away from Union Square, cable car stop across the street, and within walking distance of many great restaurants. Bad: The only negative that we saw was the rooms were a little small, but the bed made up for that, very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hello_It's_Me_21
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were able to check in and get into the room. Large room which was clean and well appointed. The hotel is located in a great area for a tourist but beware, there are homeless everywhere in the Union Square area of San Fran.--all day and night. Never did we feel uncomfortable near the hotel, though. Union square blocks away. Chinatown starts about 4 blocks away. Great shopping everywhere. Short walk to Bart. Busses all around. Trolley right outside front door. Touristy but if itâ€™s your first time to SF, you need to take it. Take the Fishermanâ€™s Wharf trolley. Not a bad walk to the convention center but if you are planning on coming back with bags of stuff from a trade show, try the Pickwick hotel a few blocks from the convention center instead. Itâ€™s a boutique hotel so the vibe is different and itâ€™s cheaper. Positives: nice little goodies in room (soaps, eyeshades, clip to hold drapes closed,, etc). Large room. Nice pillows/duvet. Good sized bathroom (not big but not tiny). Excellent pressure/heat in shower. Very quiet (you can hear cable car bell during the day only) We were on the 11th floor on the Powell St side They try to make your stay comfortable with a relaxation CD but it's a spoken word thing which was rather annoying. CD player bedside Negatives: They were supposed to be luxurious soft pillow-top beds and I wonder if our room was missed. The bed was hard and not pillow-topped.
